description: To the Editor:

title: Offer Made For Bank in Westchester
description: A group of high-profile investors, including a corporate takeover specialist and the owner of the Minnesota Twins baseball club, has offered to buy Peoples Westchester Savings Bank, the bank announced yesterday.

title: No Headline
description: "I've seen several transitions before, and let me tell you, they didn't seem nearly this long. There's a direct relationship between the length of the transition and losing. You win, it seems much too short. You lose, it lasts forever." -- JEB BUSH, the President's son. [ A14:3. ]

title: Tenure for Black Wins Support

title: An Invisible Legacy
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller spread miles of asphalt, built modern campuses and raised skyscrapers for state workers. Hugh L. Carey saved New York City from bankruptcy. Now Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, less than 22 months from the 1994 gubernatorial election, is hoping to construct a different kind of legacy, an invisible legacy built by balancing budgets and improving fiscal practices during a relentless recession.

title: Pillsbury, that staple of home pantries, tries entering the market for store-bought baked goods.
description: FOR decades, the Pillsbury Company has maintained that "nothin' says lovin' like somethin' from the oven." But in an era when even instant gratification takes too long, Pillsbury products like flour, cake mixes and frosting are frequently relegated to back shelves of home pantries. So the company is exploring a possible solution to that problem -- a product that comes, already baked, from someone else's oven.

Deep cuts in the work force, multibillion-dollar charges against earnings, a plummeting stock price, the loss of its blue-chip AAA bond rating -- a humbling litany indeed for the International Business Machines Corporation, the company once revered worldwide as the epitome of management excellence and technological prowess.

title: The Kid From Kiev Is Causing Quite a Stir
description: Court No. 8 was suddenly a very crowded place to watch a tennis match. Young men with Ukrainian flags draped over their heads to block the heavy sun were straining for a clear view. Young Australian girls were jockeying for elbow room.

title: Perez Isn't at a Loss To Ask for Big Raise
description: Melido Perez was a 13-game winner last year; worse, he was a 16-game loser. Despite that losing record, the Yankees' pitcher yesterday asked for a raise of $2,635,000, the second-largest raise sought in salary arbitration this year and the fifth largest ever.

title: Ocean Traffic Control Would Reduce Spills
description: To the Editor:

title: Dealing With Drug Dealers: Rehabilitation, Not Jail; Hynes Tries Alternative Approach Intended to Stop a Problem by Curing an Addiction
description: In 15 years of selling cocaine and heroin in the doorways and abandoned buildings of Brooklyn's pervasive Borough Park narcotics mart, Guillermo Rios developed an entrepreneurial sense of a good deal, even as he indulged his own deep addiction.

title: Hartford Ballet Names New Artistic Director
description: Kirk Peterson has been appointed artistic director of the Hartford Ballet. Mr. Peterson, 43, is a former principal dancer with American Ballet Theater and the San Francisco Ballet, where he was resident choreographer for two years.

title: Hirsch Sparkles in Debut, but Messier Is Hurt as Rangers Tie
description: The kid with the orange hair and the white helmet and the heavy heart did his best to change the Rangers' fortunes. Corey Hirsch, making his first National Hockey League start on the same day his grandfather was buried, stood in front of the Rangers' goal tonight and provided New York with more than a good chance of winning its first road game in eight games.

title: Girl Held in Bunker Says Captor Talked of Suicide
description: Sipping soda and munching on potato chips, Katie Beers told the police after her rescue from an underground bunker that John Esposito had threatened to commit suicide shortly before he led the police to her, according to excerpts from her questioning by investigators.

title: Market Place
description: WALL STREET long ago threw aside the old-fashioned world of simple stocks and bonds. Now, professional mathematicians and computer experts peel away pieces of each market like layers of an onion, creating new and more complex trading instruments to make investing less risky.

title: Top American Athletes May Boycott Title Meet
description: The Olympic gold medalists MIKE CONLEY, MICHAEL JOHNSON and GWEN TORRENCE will boycott the I.A.A.F. world indoor championships in Toronto in March unless the world governing body begins awarding prize money to top finishers, their agent said yesterday.

title: Study of Computerized Care Finds Big Patient and Hospital Savings
description: At a time when spiraling health-care costs are causing headaches from Wall Street to Washington, researchers at the Indiana University School of Medicine are offering a 13 percent solution.

title: Assist Poor School Districts, Cuomo Urges
description: Gov. Mario M. Cuomo today proposed significant changes in the way that New York State distributes aid to schools, offering a plan that would be more generous to poor districts -- including New York City -- stingier to affluent ones and less complicated for everyone.

title: New Year's Eve Ball Is in Receivership
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

Svoboda Out for Season
description: The Buffalo Sabres have lost PETR SVOBODA for the rest of the season after the defenseman suffered a knee injury Sunday against the Edmonton Oilers. The ligament in Svoboda's right knee was torn during a collision with Edmonton forward CRAIG SIMPSON in the Oilers' 3-2 victory. (AP)

title: Kent Electronics reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: Latest figures included results of Shelley-Ragon Inc., acquired Jan. 14, 1992.

title: BANC ONE CORP (N)
description: Banc One, the nation's 10th-largest banking company, reported much improved results, largely on the basis of a sharp drop in its provision for loan losses. John B. McCoy, chairman and chief executive, said that as a percentage of total loans, troubled loans and foreclosed real estate had fallen to the lowest levels in three years.

title: The First Couple: A Union of Mind and Ambition
description: In Little Rock they have a word for it: Billary.

Howe's Lawyers Sue
description: STEVE HOWE, the Yankees relief pitcher who was given three years' probation last summer for a drug violation, faces a new round in court, over another matter.

title: Comerica reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Per share results are restated to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid Jan. 4.

title: Farrow and Allen Agree He Can Visit Their Son
description: Mia Farrow will allow Woody Allen to visit their 5-year-old son pending the outcome of their battle for custody of their three children, as part of an agreement that averts a potentially painful hearing at which the two stars were to testify, a lawyer for Mr. Allen said yesterday.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: COMPAQ COMPUTER CORP., Houston, has cut prices of its Contura notebook computers as much as 16 percent.

title: MNC Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net lossThe per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

description: b-Included gain of $ 15.6 million, or $ 1.03 a unit, from the sale of the Gallatin timberlands and Belgrade sawmill.Share earnings are in units.

title: Turkish Premier Visits Syria to Mend Old Fences
description: Facing troubles across the border with Iraq and elsewhere, Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel flew to neighboring Syria today, seeking to persuade Damascus to withdraw its support for Kurdish separatists and reduce tensions on at least one of his frontiers.

title: Molex Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The share earnings and shares outstanding were restated for 25 percent November 1992 stock dividend.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Imcera Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

Results subsequent to the formation of the venture were recorded on a pretax equity basis. Related income taxes were included in Imcera's consolidated income tax provision.Latest 6 months' income from continuing operations of $ 56,700,000, or 73 cents a share, included an after-tax charge of $ 3.4 million from executive resignations at Pitman-Moore.Year-ago 6 months' income from continuing operations of $ 53,400,000, or 68 cents a share, included Included after-tax gain of $ 4.4 million, or 5 cents a share, from sale of an investment.

title: Real Estate
description: MARION MERRELL DOW INC. is moving forward with a $276 million project for its new headquarters here that is expected to transform the deteriorating section of southern Kansas City. The giant pharmaceutical company plans to consolidate its offices and expand its laboratories on a 325-acre site.

title: CHRONICLE
description: A. L. LEVINE, a shopping center developer from Palm Beach, Fla., has donated $5 million to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The gift will be used to transform a former sculpture court on the mezzanine of the Lila Acheson Wallace Wing into a gallery for 20th-century painting and sculpture.

title: Digital Microwave reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflects the fiber optics product line sold during this year's third quarter for $ 1.4 million which contributed to the performance.c-Net lossThe company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Clinton, Seen From the Left
description: When Bill Clinton was elected, most of us on the democratic left were pleased. (Some were just relieved.) We form a tendency that includes liberals, left-liberals, socialists and people from the labor, feminist, African-American and other communities, all bound by a belief in democracy and deep social change.

title: Islanders Get Even, And Then Get Mad
description: That two-game Islander scoring spree and winning streak, the one that was designed to resuscitate the team's playoff possibilities, ended tonight at Nassau Coliseum. But all was not lost, for the Islanders skated away from this low-scoring, low-impact confrontation with the Boston Bruins with a 2-2 tie.

title: Masur Offers Season Schedule
description: The New York Philharmonic, at roughly the halfway point in its 150th anniversary season, took time out yesterday to announce what it will do for an encore. The short answer is more of what worked for it this season: included among the programs announced by Kurt Masur, the orchestra's music director, and Deborah Borda, its general manager, are continuations of the thematic Philharmonic Celebrations programs, the Rush Hour and Casual Saturdays sampler concerts, the Children's Promenades and the pre-concert lectures series, all of which were introduced this season.

title: Bank of New Hampshire reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Bridge
description: An English boy who is selected to play cricket for his school wears a special cap to mark his status. When he is older, he may earn a county cap, or even an England cap. International caps, for playing in a single match against another country, are highly prized in any activity, although the cap is usually an imaginary one.

title: Hartford Gives Money to Help Convert Boat Company
description: The State of Connecticut today gave $1 million in taxpayer money to the giant Electric Boat submarine shipyard in Groton to help the company develop nonmilitary products.

title: Interstate/Johnson Lane reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax credit of $ 967,000, or 14 cents a share.c-Included a tax credit of $ 450,000, or 7 cents a share.Revenue represented net revenues.

title: Piper Jaffray Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Cornell Student Found Dead In Fraternity House Chimney
description: A Cornell University senior who had been missing since early Friday was found dead Monday night, his body lodged in the chimney of a fraternity house.

title: St. Patrick Parade Sponsor May Quit Over Gay Dispute
description: The new group that won the fight to sponsor this year's St. Patrick's Day parade may withdraw rather than face an embarrassing boycott over its inclusion of a gay and lesbian contingent, leaders in the Irish-American community said yesterday. The withdrawal could put the parade back in the hands of its traditional organizers, who want to exclude homosexuals.

title: THE NEW PRESIDENCY: Attorney General; BAIRD APOLOGIZES TO SENATE PANEL FOR ILLEGAL HIRING
description: Zoe Baird apologized today for hiring two illegal aliens to work in her house, telling the Senate Judiciary Committee, which is holding hearings on her nomination as Attorney General, that she had known she was violating the law.

title: Coca-Cola Gives Project to Lowe
description: Coca-Cola U.S.A. has selected the Lowe Group to help handle the introduction of 20-ounce plastic bottles of its Coca-Cola Classic and Diet Coke brands, patterned after the soft-drink company's contoured 6 1/2-ounce glass bottles. Billings for the project, which involves the test-marketing of the bottles, were not disclosed.

title: Giants Turn to Plan C and Meet With Reeves
description: The pressure on the Giants to find a head coach intensified yesterday when their latest choice, Dave Wannstedt, turned them down and instead became the coach of the Chicago Bears. Hours after the announcement of Wannstedt's decision, General Manager George Young of the Giants met with Dan Reeves, the Denver Broncos' former coach, to discuss the Giants job.

title: On Waiting List Before Birth: A Case of Transplant Ethics
description: In May 1991, an ultrasound examination revealed that a 17-week fetus had a potentially fatal heart malformation. Thirteen weeks later, doctors at the University of Pittsburgh put the fetus on a list of patients awaiting human hearts for transplant.

title: Pianist Cancels Appearance
description: Because of an injury, the pianist Stephanie Brown has canceled her appearance with the violinist Jaime Laredo on Friday at 8 P.M. at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Instead, Mr. Laredo will be joined by the pianist Joseph Kalichstein and the cellist Sharon Robinson in Schubert's two piano trios, Op. 99 in B flat and Op. 100 in E flat. Information: (212) 570-3949.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-12 IRAQ OFFERS A TRUCE

title: Outer Banks Journal; Is the Human Tide More of a Peril Than the Sea?
description: The news is not so good these days from the Outer Banks unless you happen to be standing in bundled solitude on a high dune, waist deep in waving sea oats, watching the winter wind whip the gray Atlantic.

title: Corrections
description: The "How They Do It" chart in Your Money on Saturday, about the tax deductibility of home offices, misidentified one deductible cost. It is mortgage interest, not mortgage insurance.

title: AN AFTERNOON WITH -- Maya Angelou; A Wordsmith at Her Inaugural Anvil
description: It was one of those Southern winter days just short of raining when the sky is so gray that it blurs the horizon and seems to fuse with the grayness on the ground. The humidity hung thick as mist and had worked its way into Maya Angelou's already aching joints. "My arthritis is bad today," she said by way of greeting. "Let's have some wine."

title: Iraqis' Gesture of 'Good Intention' Toward Clinton
description: The cease-fire announcement issued by the Iraqi press agency today said it was meant as an "expression of good intention toward the Administration of U.S. President-elect Bill Clinton and the American people."

title: Clinton Must Keep Health Care Promises
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times; Third Down, Coach to Go For Giants
description: IN the Giants' search for a new coach, it's now third down. If General Manager George Young throws another incompletion, he'll have to punt.

title: Hanna (M.A.) Co. (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 4,268,000, or 22 cents a share, and an extraordinary charge of $ 11,465,000 from an effect of adoption of Statements of Fiscal Accounting Standards 106 and 109, retroactive to Jan. 1, 1992.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 12,779,000, or 68 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 24,592,000, or $ 1.04 a share, in the year, and the year also included an extraordinary charge of $ 5,969,000.The company did not elaborate on the year-ago extraordinary charge.

title: Tokyo Journal; Prince and His Bride-to-Be: Their Special Story
description: With unusual candor for the imperial family, Crown Prince Naruhito of Japan and his fiancee today gave the first detailed account of the six years it had taken the Prince to persuade her to marry him.

title: Fifth Rejection for Olympia
description: Olympia & York Developments Ltd. said today that its lenders for the Yonge-Sheppard Center office and retail complex in North York, Ontario, were the fifth creditor group to reject its proposed restructuring plan.

title: Public Service Enterprise reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago periods were restated to reflect an accounting change at the company's Energy Development Corp. unit.

title: Wine Talk
description: When President Clinton is toasted today in Washington at the luncheon of the Joint Congressional Inaugural Committee, it will be with sparkling wine from Korbel Champagne Cellars of Sonoma County, Calif. The table wines at the lunch will be from another California winery, Jekel Vineyards, in Monterey County.

title: Northern Trust Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The bank is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: ARABS PROTESTING ATTACKS ON IRAQ
description: Saudi Arabia, the launching pad for the Persian Gulf war against Iraq two years ago, has signaled a growing unease about developments in the region, echoing the chorus of Arab criticism that the allied forces are applying a double standard when they punish Iraq.

title: Dining Well When Dining Out in Warsaw (Yes, Warsaw)
description: A group of diners gathered to celebrate a friend's birthday in the Swietoszek restaurant, noted here for its reliable Polish cuisine and elegant interior, and pulled out all stops to mark the occasion. They ordered caviar, Champagne and other trimmings now easily available in Warsaw for the first time since World World II.

title: SCHWINN BICYCLE SALE IS APPROVED
description: The sale of the 97-year-old Schwinn Bicycle Company to Scott USA and the Zell/Chilmark Fund L.P. was given final bankruptcy court approval yesterday in Chicago.

description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $ 2,000.c-After an extraordinary charge of $ 134,000.

title: Reardon Joins Reds
description: JEFF REARDON, the major league career leader in saves with 357, signed a minor league contract with the Cincinnati Reds yesterday. The 37-year-old Reardon not only had to agree to a minor league contract but also had to agree to shave his beard.

title: Rev. Kent L. Kiser; Pastor, 77
description: The Rev. Kent L. Kiser, pastor of Grace Baptist Church in Trenton for the last 33 years, died on Friday at his Trenton home. He was 77 years old.

description: Although many people are still unaware of it, there is a municipal election here on Feb. 2 that could close out the career of one of Hudson County's most durable mayors.

title: I.C.I. TO SELL SOME ASSETS TO TERRA INDUSTRIES
description: Imperial Chemical Industries P.L.C. of Britain said yesterday that it had agreed to sell its Canadian nitrogen-products businesses and 32 farm-service centers to Terra Industries of the United States for an unspecified amount. I.C.I. said Terra, based in Sioux City, Iowa, had paid "less than 1 percent of I.C.I. Group net assets" to buy the businesses. That represents a maximum of $:50 million ($77.5 million), according to calculations by the Analysis Corporation.

title: Husband Shoots 2 and Himself In Dallas Court
description: An enraged husband shot his wife and then turned the gun on himself today in the hallway of a Dallas courthouse just as they were entering a hearing on a family dispute. The woman died several hours later.

title: Green Party Merges With an East German Group
description: Anxious to return to its former position of influence in Bonn, the German Green Party has merged with a party that sprang from the human rights movement in the former East Germany.

title: A Surge in Earnings Helps Large Banks Breathe a Bit Easier
description: Five of the nation's 10 largest banks, including several New York institutions, reported higher-than-expected earnings yesterday, leading banking specialists to say that the end is in sight for the industry's troubles with real estate loans.

description: THE CATERERS' ANGER Bill Clinton has sought to please many people on his climb to the Presidency, but some in Washington are decidedly displeased: caterers. The Living Section, page C1.

Reginald F. Lewis, 50, Is Dead; Financier Led Beatrice Takeover
description: Reginald F. Lewis, a Wall Street lawyer and financier who was one of the nation's richest businessmen and a prominent corporate takeover dealer, died yesterday in Manhattan, one day after his company announced he was suffering from brain cancer. He was 50 and lived in Manhattan and Paris.

title: White House Tenants Offered Musical Mosaic
description: THE nine Mosaic Minstrels were a bit antsy as they piled on to the bus that was about to take them from their Sheepshead Bay neighborhood in Brooklyn to their first out-of-town gig.

title: Accounts
description: * Northwest Airlines, Egan, Minn., as expected, named Fallon McElligott, Minneapolis, as its lead domestic agency, without a formal review. J. Walter Thompson New York previously handled the account, with billings estimated at $25 million, until the airline dismissed that agency last month. Fallon, which previously handled Northwest's regional advertising, will be responsible for strategic and creative development of Northwest's brand and retail advertising in addition to coordinating international advertising. * Volkswagen United States Inc., Auburn Hills, Mich., to Rapp Collins Communications, Minneapolis, to handle its direct marketing account, previously divided among various agencies on a project basis. Billings were not disclosed.

title: Loyola Capital reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included credit of $ 2,708,000, or 31 cents a share, for change in accounting for income taxes.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Personal Health
description: The pharmacy's aisle of cold remedies has come to resemble the profusion of cereal products in supermarkets. There are more than 200 over-the-counter cold products on the market, and every year several dozen new ones, or more accurately reformulations or relabeling of old ones, arrive on the shelves, further confusion for those whose judgment is already clouded by a cold.

title: Charles White Hired
description: CHARLES WHITE, who won the Heisman Trophy in 1979 as a running back at Southern Cal, was hired yesterday as the Trojans' running backs coach.

title: 60-Minute Gourmet
description: Of all the cuts of beef available to home cooks, my preference is for the least-expensive varieties like shoulder, breast and skirt steak. These lean and more healthful cuts have a more compelling texture to my taste, as well as better flavor -- that is, if you cook them properly.

title: Review/Music; Mannes College Players Pay Tribute to King
description: There were several musical tributes to the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. on Monday evening, but surely one of the most inviting was the free concert at Riverside Church, in which Kurt Masur conducted a student orchestra from the Mannes College of Music in a Duke Ellington suite that commemorated Dr. King in its finale. The large interdenominational church was, in fact, an ideal place to remember Dr. King and his message: on April 4, 1967, exactly a year before he was killed, Dr. King gave an antiwar speech there, and it was tempting to imagine him standing at the pulpit.

title: CHRONICLE
description: Dr. WALTER H. MUNK, a geophysicist whose research has led to new understanding of the oceans, waves and tides and the rotation of the earth, will receive the Vetlesen Prize at Columbia University tomorrow evening.

title: Meditrust reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary write-off of $ 3,684,000 of unamortized deferred fiancing costs and fees in connection with early retirement of debt, in the quarter and year.

title: ITT Shies Away From Consumer Loans
description: The ITT Corporation announced a reorganization of its consumer lending business yesterday and set aside $693 million to pay for expected losses and another $103 million to cover the costs of closing branches and cutting jobs.

title: FIRST INTERSTATE BANCORP (N)
description: Reducing nonperforming assets by more than half and cutting expenses as well, the First Interstate Bancorp, based in Los Angeles, returned to profitability for the quarter and the year.

title: American Home Products (N)
description: The American Home Products Corporation confused investors yesterday by announcing three types of accounting charges against 1992 earnings. That probably diverted attention from a solid 13 percent pretax sales growth in the fourth quarter in the New York-based company's core pharmaceuticals business.

title: Signet Banking reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and the quarer included provision of $ 146.6 million to establish accelerated real estate asset reduction program.

title: Rangers' Cavalcade Of 'Stars' Heads West
description: In a city where sport is as much about star-gazing as athletics, there should be some disappointment among those holding tickets for Saturday night's game between the Rangers and the Los Angeles Kings.

title: THE INAUGURATION: Pomp, Patriotism and Primping; Far More Than 10,000 Maniacs Revel in Capital as Bubbles Banish Fatigue
description: As President Clinton took the oath of office, the fate of the nation symbolized by a single right hand held high, a hush came over the beauty salon of Gabriel DeBakey, the First Lady's inaugural evening hair dresser.

title: Global Marine reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary credit on extinguishment of debt of $ 28,300,000, or 24 cents a share, in both the quarter and year, and an extraordinary charge from effect of change in accounting for retiree benefits of $ 1,900,000 in the quarter and income of $ 1,400,000, or 1 cent a share, in the year.

title: Stanley H. Katz Is Dead at 70; Pioneer in Advertising Industry
description: Stanley H. Katz, a leading figure in the advertising industry in the United States, died on Tuesday as he traveled to his home in West Orange, N.J. He was 70.

title: Matlack Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and included a charge of $ 190,000, which was restated, to reflect the retroactive adoption of a change in the method of revenue recognition.

title: Place for Parties on Wall Street
description: It was one of those obviously brilliant ideas: transform the former New York Cocoa Exchange, a high-ceilinged, 7,000-square-foot space that had been in disuse for years, into a gleaming white-painted room to serve as an espresso bar and restaurant by day and a place to entertain at night and on weekends. It's called Dean & Deluca Wall Street, and it is the latest venture of the company known for its food stores and simple, stylish coffee bars.

title: Coast Savings Financial reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 10,914,000, or 67 cents a share.Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: Defiance Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Algonquin Mercantile reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 25
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company said results included the income associated with the recently acquired operations of Pharmaservice Inc. This integration was completed last July.

title: Cuomo's Plan to Divert School Aid Comes Under Fire
description: Gov. Mario M. Cuomo's proposal to divert state aid from wealthy to poor school districts came under attack today from officials in New York City's suburbs, which would bear the brunt of the cuts needed to make the plan work.

title: Wisconsin Offers Tax-Exempt Issue
description: Wisconsin is offering $279.2 million of tax-exempt general obligation refunding bonds through underwriters led by Bear, Stearns.

title: Giving a Tired Wax Finish a Healthy Glow Again
description: Plain beeswax was the traditional finish in the European Age of Oak that lasted for about a century, until 1700. An oil may have been used for the initial coat, and it, rather thanthe wax, accounts for much of the dark furniture called black oak. But whether the oak was oiled or waxed or both, the treatment was more to protect it than to enhance its appearance.

title: Corrections
description: An article in The Living Section yesterday about some Washington caterers' unhappiness with their treatment by the Presidential Inaugural Committee misidentified a co-executive director of the committee. He is Rahm Emanuel.

title: Few Haitians Test U.S. Sea Barricade
description: After weeks of anticipation that the inauguration of President Clinton would be accompanied by a new wave of Haitian emigration, only one boat carrying would-be refugees was intercepted by Coast Guard ships massed in waters near here today.

title: Devils Relax, And Then Regret It
description: It was for only seven or eight minutes in the second period that the Devils let their intensity fall tonight against the Canadiens, but it was enough to cost them dearly.

title: Corrections
description: A brief report in Business Day yesterday about the earnings of the Chemical Banking Corporation misstated the year in which the company took a $625 million charge against its earnings for a merger-related revamping. It was 1991.

title: BMC Software reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago results are restated to reflect use of new accounting method for software revenue recognition.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Airport Financing In Portland, Ore.
description: The Port of Portland, Ore., is selling $115 million of revenue bonds for Portland International Airport, with a majority of the financing in securities that for some investors may be subject to the Federal alternative minimum tax.

title: Circle in the Square Struggling to Survive
description: The Circle in the Square Theater, spiritual parent to the Off Broadway movement and progenitor of New York's growing nonprofit theater boom, is struggling for survival. Its season, which was supposed to start in November, has now been postponed until April, amid speculation in the theater industry that its doors will not reopen at all.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: NEW YORK CITY TRANSIT FARE CARDS FACING DELAYS

title: The Ex-Commissioner Seems Content to Stay Clear of Controversy
description: It was advertised as an event in which Fay Vincent would talk about baseball for the first time since he was forced to resign as commissioner four and a half months ago. Vincent, however, taking a cue from one of his predecessors, had little to say about the game or why he is no longer a part of it, giving baseball only the slightest passing glance on his way to a life in which he says he is now totally at peace.

title: AT HOME WITH/David Hockney; Acquainted With the Light
description: Had David Hockney painted a century earlier, he might have moved from dreary northern England to sun-blasted Provence, but instead it was to Los Angeles that he famously migrated in 1964.

title: Rome Journal; Wounded Lion of Italian Politics Pounces on Foes
description: As scandals swirl around his party and Mafia informers seek to link him to their world of crime, Giulio Andreotti, Italy's enduring political eminence for more than four decades, wants to set the record straight, and even to go on the offensive.

title: Automating Transit Fares Runs Afoul
description: The automated-fare system due to open early next year in New York City's buses and subway stations has encountered delays and cost overruns because of design flaws and equipment delivery problems, transit officials said yesterday.

description: The bank is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: For Al Gore, More for Less
description: Bill Clinton and Al Gore both raised their right hands and solemnly swore today, but Mr. Gore swore to a little more.

description: Nine-Day Show Seventh Regiment Armory, 643 Park Avenue, at 66th Street; (212) 665-5250.

title: Kyrgyzstan Is Planning Embassy in Jerusalem
description: In an unusual break with international practice, the mostly Muslim republic of Kyrgyzstan in Central Asia has decided to establish an embassy in Jerusalem, not Tel Aviv, the Israeli Foreign Ministry said today.

title: Fidelity Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a pretax gain of $ 458,000 from the sale of mortgage-backed securities.

title: Katie Beers Likes New Home, Official Says
description: Katie Beers is flourishing in her new foster home and has begun attending school, the Suffolk County District Attorney said today after the arraignment of John Esposito on kidnapping and sexual-abuse charges.

description: As an Iraqi cease-fire went into effect, yellow Caterpillar tractors continued today to plow through mangled concrete and twisted metal at Al Nida General Establishment for Dies and Molds.

title: Economic Scene
description: THERE may be a way for the United States Treasury to put a bit more zing in the recovery while still reducing the budget deficit. And Bill Clinton's advisers know it.

title: Audio King Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RESURGENS STOCK DIVES BEFORE TRADING IS HALTED
description: Shares of Resurgens Communications Group plummeted 11 percent yesterday before trading was halted, even though the Atlanta-based company said its merger with Metromedia Communications remained on track. The stock fell $4, to $32.125, on the American Stock Exchange. An order imbalance halted trading at 3:33 P.M., Eastern time.

title: Bridge
description: Very few players ever have the pleasure of playing one event and emerging with two titles. It happened a week ago at the Tri-State Regional Championships in Port Chester, N.Y., when James Gleick of Brooklyn and Judy Goulding of Manhattan entered for the Stratified Pairs Flight C and won not only that title but also Flight B, normally the preserve of more experienced players.

title: Throw Away the Crutch of Bilingual Education; Family Does It Better
description: To the Editor:

title: A Year After Shooting, Officer Struggles Back
description: The bullet came from the darkness of the stairway. It hit the police officer above the left eyebrow. The explosion was the loudest noise he had ever heard.

title: Judges in Dallas Continue Shutdown Over Security
description: Frustrated and angered by Dallas County's slowness in securing the courts, state and county judges here refused to reopen their courtrooms today and vowed to keep them closed until metal detectors or X-ray machines were installed.

title: Many Last Names Are Now a First
description: When Elise Goldstein and Baruch Browns of Toronto were married six years ago, they discussed what name they would pass on to their offspring. "We absolutely wanted a family name," said Ms. Goldstein, a rabbi. But, she added, they wanted a creative alternative to passing on only the father's surname.

title: Corrections
description: A sports article yesterday about the United States figure skating championships in Phoenix misstated the Saturday television broadcast times. ABC-TV will carry live coverage from 4:30 to 6 P.M. and from 9 to 11 P.M., Eastern time.

title: Now, What About Iraq?
description: Baghdad's decision to stop shooting at American planes as a "good-will gesture" to President Clinton is welcome. So is its agreement to stop obstructing U.N. flights. But neither gesture represents progress. They are just the latest example of Saddam Hussein's "cheat and retreat" defiance.

title: Parole Advised for Woman Who Killed Abusive Partner
description: Gov. William F. Weld today recommended commuting the life sentence of a woman convicted of murdering her former boyfriend in 1986, saying he accepted her defense that she had acted after she had been stalked and battered for months.

title: Adults Who Take Piano Need Teachers With the Right Touch
description: Anna Chang was haunted all her life by a road not taken when she was 6. That is, until she decided to stop trying to tune out the music inside her head and play it instead. For Mrs. Chang, her 40's are the time to get serious about piano lessons.

title: Freddie Mac Share Price Hits Record
description: Shares of the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation hit a record high yesterday after it disclosed that an investor group including Warren E. Buffett had enlarged its stake to 9 percent of the mortgage corporation, also known as Freddie Mac.

title: Biogen Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Fiscal 1991 share earnings is after preferred dividends of $ 2,679,000.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Russell Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 2
American Savings of Florida reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago quarter included extraordinary tax credits of $ 6.4 million.

title: Review/Dance; Balanchine's One-Act Compression of 'Swan Lake'
description: George Balanchine's one-act version of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" is more a gloss upon the standard four-act 19th-century classic than the digest it appears. The latest Swan Queen in the New York City Ballet to deal with the production's ambiguities is Kyra Nichols, who came off more than splendidly on Sunday afternoon at the New York State Theater.

title: Nationsbank Lifts Debt Offering
description: The Nationsbank Corporation increased its debt offering, to $400 million from $350 million, because of strong investor demand, which was tied to the concern's report of higher fourth-quarter profits Monday.

title: Throw Away the Crutch of Bilingual Education
description: To the Editor:

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Israel (Cachao) Lopez Radio City Music Hall

title: MagneTek Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a loss of $ 35,734,000 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for postretirement welfare benefits, and a loss of $ 13 million from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes.c-Net income and included an extraordinary loss of $ 2,857,000 from the early extinguishment of debt, in the quarter and 6 months.MagneTek said that much of its year-to-year revenue gain is attributable to the March 1992 acquisition of May & Christe GmbH, a European manufacturer of lighting ballasts and transformers.

title: The New Czechs and Slovaks Find a New Tax Expensive
description: The introduction of a value-added tax on goods and services in the Czech and Slovak republics has resulted in higher prices than predicted, prompting criticism of the two Governments and of shopkeepers.

title: Eleanor Hibbert, Novelist Known As Victoria Holt and Jean Plaidy
description: Eleanor Hibbert, a prolific and popular novelist whose books, written under the pen names Jean Plaidy, Victoria Holt and Philippa Carr, sold more than 100 million copies, died on Monday aboard a Mediterranean cruise ship. She was believed to be in her 80's.

title: Germantown Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a loss of $ 2,419,000 due to an accounting change.c-Included a gain of 775,000, or 19 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 3,100,000, or 76 cents a share, in the year.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball National League

title: 'Bill' Tries On 'William J.' for Size
description: His penmanship may still be sloppy, but the new chief executive tried today to give his signature a more Presidential style: he changed it from Bill Clinton, which he used as Governor of Arkansas, to William J. Clinton.

title: A Party Place on Wall Street
description: It was one of those obviously brilliant ideas: transform the former New York Cocoa Exchange, a high-ceilinged, 7,000-square-foot space that had been in disuse for years, into a gleaming white-painted room to serve as an espresso bar and restaurant by day and a place to entertain at night and on weekends. It's called Dean & Deluca Wall Street, and it is the latest venture of the company known for its food stores and simple, stylish coffee bars.

title: A Change of Power, but Barely a Break in Stride
description: Today was the day of Bill Clinton's dreams, the day he and his party finished the arduous climb to a "joyful mountaintop of celebration," but like all Inauguration Days, it was more than that.

title: Cardinal Distribution reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 2.2 million from non-recurring items.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Throw Away the Crutch of Bilingual Education; Essential to Progress
description: To the Editor:

title: 62 Rebounds By Celtics Sink Hawks
description: Celtics 121, Hawks 106

title: First Tennessee reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included charge of $ 15.6 million related to the December 1992 acquisition of Home Financial Corp. in both the quarter and year.The bank is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Cincinnati Bell reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge from early extinguishment of debt of $ 2,018,000 and $ 3,690,000 in the quarter and year, respectively, and both the quarter and year are reduced by $ 12.9 million from charges taken by the company's information management subsidiary, CBIS unit.c-Net income

title: Bankers Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain on securities and loans of $ 3,300,000 and $ $ 3,911,000 in the quarter and year, respectively, and the year also included a charge of $ 1,858,000 from cumulative effect of accounting changes; adoption ofFASB 106, 107 and 109.c-Included a gain on securities jand loans of $ 695,000 in the quarter and $ $ 784,000 in the year.Shares outstanding are fully diluted.All per-share results have been adjusted to reflect a 10 percent stock dividend, effective Jan. 30.

title: Herman's Picks Account Finalists
description: Herman's Sporting Goods Inc. said yesterday that it had narrowed the review on its estimated $25 million to $30 million account, previously handled in-house, to two candidates from four.

title: Sports of The Times; Buffalo's Haunting Refrain
description: Aseed has been planted in the minds of the Buffalo Bills and a question grows and echoes from it: "Are you ever going to win a Super Bowl? Are you ever going to win a Super Bowl? Are you ever going to win a Super Bowl?"

title: Koss Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Picking Up the Perks Of Presidential Power
description: IT'S not just the country that must adjust to the idea of a President Clinton. Bill Clinton himself is still feeling the shock.

title: Making the Desert Glow
description: The gulf war lives on, as this week's air strikes against Iraq have proved. But the conflict goes beyond Iraqi missile batteries in forbidden places. It extends, frighteningly, to radioactive artillery shells used by coalition forces two years ago. The spent rounds may be the cause of fatal illnesses, including cancer and mysterious new stomach ailments, showing up in Iraqi children. Because of sanctions and war, the death rate of children under 5 has tripled. In the first eight months of 1991 alone, 50,000 children died.

title: NORTHWEST AIRLINES AND KLM SET JOINT FLIGHTS
description: Northwest Airlines and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines said yesterday that they would begin joint flights on April 4, creating the world's third-largest airline system and linking more than 300 cities in 100 countries. The two airlines will operate as if a single entity, while retaining separate ownership and corporate structures. KLM holds a 20 percent stake in Northwest's parent company. In the most visible evidence of their agreement, the airline companies will adopt a corporate insignia combining the KLM and Northwest logos and using the phrase "worldwide reliability."

title: American Air Parent's Loss Wider
description: The AMR Corporation, parent of American Airlines, yesterday reported a fourth-quarter loss of $200 million and warned that it might have to shut some of its unprofitable hubs and cut its fleet to curb losses.

title: Bancorp Hawaii reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Knape & Vogt Manufacturing reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said all share earnings have been restated to reflect a 10 percent stock dividend paid on Sept. 11, 1992.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Corrections
description: An article on the Health page yesterday about the placing of fetuses on a waiting list for heart transplants misstated an affiliation of Dr. Arthur Caplan. He is director of the Center for Biomedical Ethics at the University of Minnesota, not the University of Pittsburgh.

title: Russia Battles Inflation With Financial Controls
description: Shaken by a new surge of inflation that has sent prices up by more than 30 percent in three weeks, the Government moved today to impose tighter financial controls by restricting low-cost industrial credits, raising bank interest rates and issuing bonds to finance the budget deficit.

title: Throw Away the Crutch of Bilingual Education; Family Does It Better
description: To the Editor:

title: ASK Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net lossc-After an extraordinary charge of $ 54,822,000 from writedown of goodwill and intangible assets in both the quarter and 6 months.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Lindros's Day in Court
description: ERIC LINDROS, surrounded by a mob of television and newspaper photographers, strode into court yesterday morning in Oshawa, Ontario, to face trial on charges arising out of a barroom incident.

title: U.S. Set Back in Vote on W.H.O. Chief
description: A Japanese doctor, Dr. Hiroshi Nakajima, won a key vote yesterday for re-election as head of the World Health Organization despite a vigorous diplomatic campaign by the United States and its European allies to unseat him.

title: Ukraine Needs Reassurance From West; Real Russian Threat
description: To the Editor:

title: Problem-Solver Relishes Redoing Westchester
description: Sal J. Prezioso, the man charged with bringing order to Westchester County's cumbersome system of overlapping local governments, will celebrate his 80th birthday on Valentine's Day. He will celebrate it, that is, assuming he can squeeze it into his schedule of 12-hour days and 6-day weeks. (He has not taken a vacation in seven years, he said, and he is proud of it.)

title: Report on Melee in Belmar Criticizes Resort and MTV
description: A commission investigating the civil disturbance that erupted last summer in Belmar after a two-day concert and sports event today criticized the seaside resort and the event's sponsor, MTV, for not providing enough security at the event.

title: Market Place
description: IN December, the airline industry seemed to have turned the corner from a period of low traffic, unstable pricing and rising fuel prices. A series of fare increases raised prices by about 10 to 15 percent, and there were signs that more people were flying.

title: Calendar: Gardens and Valentines
description: Garden Talks The National Arts Club, 15 Gramercy Park South; (718) 549-3200.

title: Reputed Crime Boss Is Said to Have Stored Cash in Hideaway
description: While eluding a police manhunt for two and a half years, Anthony Casso, the reputed acting boss of the Lucchese crime family, stored $340,000 and internal Federal Bureau of Investigation documents on his case in a hideaway in New Jersey, law-enforcement officials said yesterday.

title: Carpenter Technology reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MISSTEPS BY CHIEF OF F.B.I. DETAILED
description: In what reads more like a tell-all book than a Government document, the Justice Department ethics report on William S. Sessions, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, paints a biting, gossipy picture of the backstairs life of a high Government official abusing his public office for private convenience and personal gain.

title: AMOCO CHEMICAL SELLING SUBSIDIARY TO PETROLITE
description: The Amoco Chemical Company said yesterday that it had agreed to sell Welchem Inc., a maker of chemicals for the petroleum industry, to the Petrolite Corporation for an undisclosed price. Amoco Chemical last year sold its petroleum additives business and its carpet yarn business. It is also trying to sell a polystyrene plant in Torrance, Calif.

title: A Quotation From St. Paul
description: The passage of Scripture quoted by President Clinton yesterday near the end of his Inaugural Address came from St. Paul's letter to the Galatians 6:9: "And let us not be weary in well-doing, for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not."

title: Raids on Iraq: Few Choices for Clinton
description: The American-led air strikes launched against Iraq in the final days of the Bush Administration were too small to deliver a punishing military blow to President Saddam Hussein's Government. But they were large enough to cause problems between the United States and its allies, limiting the options for the Clinton Administration.

title: Infant Administration Tackles Full-Grown Workload
description: Two hours after Bill Clinton took the oath of office, before the new boss had arrived and before the parade had even begun, his senior economic aides met at the White House for the first time. Shortly after that, his communications staff did the same.

title: Champion International reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a loss of $ 17 million from culmulative adjustment for accounting changes and $ 454 million one-time after-tax charge.c-Net income

title: Modine Manufacturing reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: THE INAUGURATION: Bowing Out; Citizen Bush Goes Home And Says He Is Satisfied
description: Leaving behind a capital where he exercised power for much of his life, George Bush, ex-President and private citizen, today returned to the city where he began his political career as a young man, proclaiming himself satisfied.

title: INSIDE
description: Serbs Accept Peace Pact

title: Children's Place Mats That Teach
description: Sitting at the dining table has never ranked as a favorite activity of young children. Generations have grown up practicing the eat-and-run style of dining -- nibbling a few bites, running away to play, and repeating the pattern until their parents' patience is worn out.

title: Navistar In Union Pact
description: The Navistar International Corporation and the United Automobile Workers have reached a tentative agreement on a new contract covering 7,600 employees at 11 plants.

title: 'We Force the Spring': Transcript of Address By President Clinton
description: Following is a transcript of President Clinton's Inaugural Address yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: THE INAUGURATION: An American Event; From Afar, New Hope For Change
description: Two thousand miles from the nation's Capitol, workers in offices on Market Street here gathered around televisions and radios today to hear the promise of a new Presidency.

title: Scientists Set to Give Up on Galileo's Antenna
description: After repeated failures to jolt free the Galileo spacecraft's stuck main antenna, engineers have abandoned all realistic hope of deploying the antenna on the craft's mission to Jupiter. They have begun preparations to salvage the mission by making the most of a weaker, slower-transmitting small antenna.

title: James R. Venable, 92 Leader of Klan Group
description: James R. Venable, a Georgia lawyer and white supremacist who organized a major Ku Klux Klan faction in 1963 and headed it for nearly 25 years, died Monday in Lawrenceville, Ga. He was 92 and lived in a nursing home in Lawrenceville.

title: REN Corp.-USA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included tax credits of $ 35,000 in the quarter and $ 802,900, or 8 cents a share, in the year.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Letterman's No. 1 Question: Where?; New York City and Los Angeles Are Weighed for New Show
description: If this were a late-night talk show and we had limped through the monologue and the first commercial and it was time for the top 10 list, the No. 1 question would be (drum roll, please): Now that David Letterman has decided to switch networks, will he also switch cities?

title: Tigers Release Bergman
description: The Detroit Tigers have ended a nine-year association with backup first baseman and designated hitter DAVE BERGMAN.

title: New President Named at Bozell
description: Joan H. Walker has been named president at Bozell Public Relations in New York, effective immediately, succeeding Fred Thompson, 46, who left to pursue other interests, the agency said.

title: Foreign Affairs; Shaping Change
description: Candidate Bill Clinton promised "to focus like a laser beam" on domestic problems. The priority was correct; the promise, unrealistic. Yesterday in his Inaugural Address, President Clinton set aside the pledge and said that "To renew America, we must meet challenges abroad as well as at home."

title: Newmil Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Ameritech Corp. (N)
description: The Ameritech Corporation's fourth-quarter earnings of $335.5 million, or $1.25 a share, were higher than the average Wall Street estimate of $1.23 a share, an analyst survey by Zacks Investment Research showed.

title: CLINTON TAKES OATH AS 42D PRESIDENT, URGING SACRIFICE TO 'RENEW AMERICA'
description: William Jefferson Clinton became the 42d President of the United States today, and in an Inaugural Address striking in its appeal for sacrifice, he told Americans that if they assume greater responsibility for their country's future, "there is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America."

title: Ukraine Needs Reassurance From West; Real Russian Threat
description: To the Editor:

title: Data General Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
Great Western Financial Corp. (N)
description: In a redoubled effort to sell its troubled real estate assets by cutting asking prices, the Great Western Financial Corporation further wrote down the value of its troubled commercial loans to 50 percent, which resulted in increasing its loan-loss provisions to $335 million in the fourth quarter. That provision led to an unexpected loss of $97.3 million.

title: Genentech Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Mr. Cuomo's Welcome Austerity
description: In his proposed budget, Gov. Mario Cuomo tries to make up for past fiscal sins by going straight, or mostly straight. He tries fewer gimmicks and makes more stringent cuts. He wants a fairer allocation of school aid, and if there's no income tax cut, there's no income tax increase either.

title: Executive Changes
description: AMERICAN TELEPHONE AND TELEGRAPH CO., New York, named Kenneth M. Bertaccini, president and chief executive at AT& T Consumer Products in Parsippany, N.J., to the new position of senior vice president and chief quality officer. He will be based in Basking Ridge, N.J. BOSTON TECHNOLOGY INC., Wakefield, Mass., a telecommunications company, named John C. Taylor president and chief executive, succeeding David S. Gergacz, who will remain as an adviser.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: The Mad Hatters The Wetlands

title: Surgery for Humphries
description: Quarterback STAN HUMPHRIES, who helped the San Diego Chargers become the first 0-4 team to reach the National Football League playoffs, had arthroscopic surgery to repair partly torn cartilage in his left shoulder.

title: NABISCO CLOSING ITS MARGARINE PLANT IN NEW JERSEY
description: Nabisco Foods Group said yesterday that it would close its 31-year-old margarine plant in Pennsauken, N.J., in April, eliminating more than 100 jobs. Nabisco said it was considering other uses for the 100,000-square-foot plant but would sell it if none is found. Nabisco is a unit of New York-based food and tobacco giant RJR Nabisco.

title: Exodus to a Brooklyn Neighborhood Slows to a Trickle
description: Just as tinted glasses conceal his dark eyes and bushy brows, silence hides parts of the tailor's bittersweet tale about his brother's efforts to join his family in Brooklyn.

title: A Touch of Designer Taste
description: At a recent party for Betty Sherrill, the chairwoman of the Winter Antiques Show, people milled around Bill Blass's perfectly appointed Sutton Place apartment, nibbling on smoked salmon and caviar napoleons and oohing and aahing at the sophisticated decor.

title: Country Cachet in the City
description: If you yearn for Adirondack twig chairs and furnishings with carved deer heads and painted grizzly bears, forget about trekking upstate for the real thing. Just head for ABC Carpet and Home, the home furnishings emporium at 888 Broadway (at 19th Street), and poke around the latest boutique on the fourth floor. It's called Toad Hall -- after the house in the classic children's book "Wind in the Willows."

title: Kansas City Southern Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge which reflects debt retirement of $ 3,800,000 in both the quarter and year.

title: Emerson Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Saga Continues
description: Track and field's London-based world governing body plans no further disciplinary action against BUTCH REYNOLDS but is considering a libel suit against him, a top International Amateur Athletic Federation official said yesterday.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: State Parole Board Gives Jean Harris Her Freedom
description: Jean S. Harris was granted freedom to resume her life today, 13 years after the killing of her lover, Dr. Herman Tarnower.

title: THE INAUGURATION: A Part of the Parade; One Family Rises Early to Partake of History
description: Three and a half hours into her vigil along the inaugural parade route, Brenda Waller tried to move her shoulders in the crush so her husband, Don, could hear her say: "You know what we've become? We've become those people we see on TV. You know, when we say, 'Why are those people out there?' "

title: Westinghouse's Earnings Tumble by 33.6% in Quarter
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation reported a 33.6 percent decline in its fourth-quarter earnings yesterday and ended 1992 with a loss of $1.291 billion for the year.

title: Boise Cascade reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a charge of $ 73,450,000 which represents a noncash charge for the adoption of Financial Accounting Standards Board requirements to accrue the cost of postretirement benefits other than pensions.The company said fiscal 1992 sales declined because of the divestiture of the company's wholesale office products distribution operations, the sale of certain nonstrategic corrugated container facilities, and falling paper prices.The company also said that after excluding the effect of the accounting change and other nonrecurring gains and charges in both 1991 and 1992, the company lost $ 4.79 per fully diluted share in 1992, compared with a loss in 1991 of $ 3.84 per fully diluted share.During the fourth quarter of 1992, the company adopted, effective as of Jan. 1, 1992, the Financial Accounting Standards Board's new requirements applicable to accounting for postretirement benefits other than pensions. The company's retiree health care costs that had previously been recorded when paid are now accrued.

title: THE INAUGURATION: The New Cabinet; Senate Confirms First Nominees Of Clinton Team
description: Without opposition, the Senate today confirmed three of President Clinton's Cabinet nominees. The senators moved quickly on two because of their critical national security roles and on the third because he is a longtime friend and colleague.

title: Streaking Nets To Face Bulls
description: The Nets, who are on a five-game winning streak, will try to end a seven-game losing streak tonight when they take on Michael Jordan and the defending champion Chicago Bulls before a sold-out crowd at Byrne Meadowlands Arena in East Rutherford, N.J.

title: Dow Falls 14.04 as Volume Remains Heavy
description: It was generally a Clinton kind of market yesterday, with larger stocks continuing downward but smaller issues eking out some gains.

title: Books of The Times;   Empire-Building in the Peacetime Army
description: Buffalo Soldiers By Robert O'Connor 324 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $22

title: Albert Hourani, 77, Acclaimed Mideast Scholar
description: Prof. Albert Hourani, a reknowned scholar and author on Middle Eastern history, died Sunday in Oxford, England. He was 77 years old.

title: William Bentinck-Smith, Harvard Historian
description: William Bentinck-Smith, an administrator and historian of Harvard University, died Tuesday at the Nashoba Community Hospital in Ayer, Mass. He was 79 and lived in Groton, Mass.

title: A Dawn of Promise
description: Now, at long last, Bill Clinton of Arkansas is President Clinton, and it is time to take him at his word. In a ceremony of sweeping dignity, he capped a campaign fueled by promises of many kinds with two crowning pledges to the American people. The 42d President said he would bring a new dawn of compassion and a higher standard of ethical behavior in Washington.

title: Money Market Funds Slow Their Fall in Latest Week
description: Yields offered by tax-exempt and taxable money market funds were down in the latest reporting week, but the declines were not as severe as those posted a week earlier.

title: Critic's Notebook; In the Inaugural of Inclusion, All the Arts Are In
description: The few Americans who were not invited to any of the entertainments of recent days and had to make do with the tube had both a broader and closer view of this populist pageant than any of the nobs on the A-list.

title: CCB Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The bank is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: CHRONICLE
description: Ever since he arrived in the United States after having been expelled from the Soviet Union in 1974, ALEKSANDR SOLZHENITSYN has refused to accept the hundreds of degrees, honors and awards that all sorts of institutions and universities have tried to bestow upon him. So officers of the National Arts Club, on Gramercy Park, considered it a coup when the Nobel laureate agreed to let them give him a medal of honor for literature at the club's 25th-annual literary awards dinner Tuesday.

title: Laurel Savings Association reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Ukraine Needs Reassurance From West
description: To the Editor:

title: Virginia Winning Streak Is Stopped in a Rout
description: The Virginia Cavaliers brought the longest winning streak in the nation to the wrong place, at the wrong time, against the wrong team tonight.

title: Freda Corp. reports earnings for 13wks to Aug 29
description: b-After an extraordinary credit of $ 697,947.c-Net income and included an extraordinary credit of $ 675,400.Revenue represents gross revenues.

title: Private Colleges Upset Over Cuomo Aid Cuts
description: Officials at private colleges throughout the state say Gov. Mario M. Cuomo's proposal to cut Tuition Assistance Program grants and other college student aid will hurt students at private colleges disproportionately.

title: Ukraine Needs Reassurance From West; Real Russian Threat
description: To the Editor:

title: Santa Fe Pacific Pipeline reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 16,407,000, which reflected the cumulative effect of change in accounting for post-retirement benefits costs.

title: More Donors to Neediest Honor a Slain Principal
description: The life and death of Patrick Daly, the elementary school principal who inspired thousands of children in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Red Hook, continues to weigh heavily on the minds of contributors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. Since The Times published an article last month on people who donated to the fund in his memory, dozens of others have followed suit.

title: Northwest Corp. (N)
description: The growth in the Norwest Corporation's fourth-quarter earnings of $138 million, more than 24 percent, was driven primarily by mortgage and finance-company subsidiaries. Those units had particularly strong growth, up 53 percent, to $58 million. But profits from its banking business, which is concentrated in the upper Midwest, grew 12 percent, to $82.3 million.

title: Seeking a Perfect 6 At a Precocious 12
description: The figure-skating coach went to a coaches convention in Canada. Where was the harm in that?

title: Family Discounts Help Ease Costs
description: With the price of adult lift tickets ranging from $30 to $40 and children's tickets going for $20 to $30, it could cost a family of four as much as $140 a day just to use the snow. But parents may find that by reading the fine print on lift ticket price lists, by planning ski trips in tandem or as a family group, the costs drop significantly.

title: An Architect Abroad, Fitting In on the Floors of Nepal
description: This city, which dates to the 12th century, has no street names or numbered addresses. Instead, each house has a name. In Timila House, a four-story brick and timber structure with lavishly carved doors and shutters near the palace square, lives Erich Theophile, a 34-year-old American architect.

title: Steep Tariffs on Steel Expected Next Week
description: The Commerce Department is likely to impose broad steel-import tariffs averaging up to 25 percent next Wednesday, American steel industry officials and trade experts said today. The move would follow action by the department late Tuesday imposing tariffs up to 167 percent on a narrow category of imported steel products.

title: Conner Peripherals reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included an unusual item of $ 57.6 million, which represents a charge for in-process research and development incurred in connection with the acquisition of Archive Corp. in the quarter.

title: Rain Soaks U.S. Art in Amsterdam
description: A leak in the roof of the Stedelijk Museum has damaged several large paintings, among them four works by prominent American artists.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: ARMCO INC., Parsippany, N.J., said it would consolidate its Bowman Metal Deck division with its Empire-Detroit Steel division and shut a steel fabricating plant in suburban Pittsburgh this spring, resulting in about 125 job losses. QUANTUM CHEMICAL CORP., New York, said it would move its corporate offices to Cincinnati by the end of the year.

title: Fierce Defense Is Making the Bills Even Better
description: The low point for the Bills' defense occurred in Week 2. Buffalo was caught in a track meet with the San Francisco 49ers' offense. When the game was over, the teams had combined for 1,086 yards. And there were no punts, a first in the National Football League.

title: Innovex Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 109,814.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Exabyte Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 2
description: The company said total research and development spending was $ 7,070,000 versus $ 5,228,000 in the fourth quarter and $ 36,365,000 versus $ 21,101,000 in the full year. The latest fiscal year total included a charge of $ 13,469,000 from the acquisition of R-Byte Inc.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Maya Angelou: 'On the Pulse of Morning'
description: A Rock, A River, A Tree Hosts to species long since departed, Marked the mastodon, The dinosaur, who left dried tokens Of their sojourn here On our planet floor, Any broad alarm of their hastening doom Is lost in the gloom of dust and ages. But today, the Rock cries out to us, clearly, forcefully, Come, you may stand upon my Back and face your distant destiny, But seek no haven in my shadow. I will give you no hiding place down here. You, created only a little lower than The angels, have crouched too long in The bruising darkness Have lain too long Face down in ignorance. Your mouths spilling words Armed for slaughter. The Rock cries out to us today, you may stand upon me, But do not hide your face. Across the wall of the world, A River sings a beautiful song, Come, rest here by my side. Each of you, a bordered country, Delicate and strangely made proud, Yet thrusting perpetually under siege. Your armed struggles for profit Have left collars of waste upon My shore, currents of debris upon my breast. Yet today I call you to my riverside, If you will study war no more. Come, Clad in peace, and I will sing the songs The Creator gave to me when I and the Tree and the rock were one. Before cynicism was a bloody sear across your Brow and when you yet knew you still Knew nothing. The River sang and sings on. There is a true yearning to respond to The singing River and the wise Rock. So say the Asian, the Hispanic, the Jew The African, the Native American, the Sioux, The Catholic, the Muslim, the French, the Greek The Irish, the Rabbi, the Priest, the Sheikh, The Gay, the Straight, the Preacher, The Privileged, the Homeless, the Teacher. They hear. They all hear The speaking of the Tree. Today, the first and last of every Tree Speaks to humankind. Come to me, here beside the River. Plant yourself beside me, here beside the River. Each of you, descendant of some passed On traveller, has been paid for. You, who gave me my first name, you, Pawnee, Apache, Seneca, you Cherokee Nation, who rested with me, then Forced on bloody feet, Left me to the employment of Other seekers -- desperate for gain, Starving for gold. You, the Turk, the Swede, the German, the Eskimo, the Scot, You the Ashanti, the Yoruba, the Kru, bought, Sold, stolen, arriving on a nightmare Praying for a dream. Here, root yourselves beside me. I am that Tree planted by the River, Which will not be moved. I, the Rock, I, the River, I, the Tree I am yours -- your passages have been paid. Lift up your faces, you have a piercing need For this bright morning dawning for you. History, despite its wrenching pain, Cannot be unlived, but if faced With courage, need not be lived again. Lift up your eyes upon The day breaking for you. Give birth again To the dream. Women, children, men, Take it into the palms of your hands, Mold it into the shape of your most Private need. Sculpt it into The image of your most public self. Lift up your hearts Each new hour holds new chances For new beginnings. Do not be wedded forever To fear, yoked eternally To brutishness. The horizon leans forward, Offering you space to place new steps of change. Here, on the pulse of this fine day You may have the courage To look up and out and upon me, the Rock, the River, the Tree, your country. No less to Midas than the mendicant. No less to you now than the mastodon then. Here, on the pulse of this new day You may have the grace to look up and out And into your sister's eyes, into Your brother's face, your country And say simply Very simply With hope Good morning.

The multimedia field, which is small but growing fast, combines computer, video and communications technologies. In recent years, the International Business Machines Corporation and many other companies have been working to meld these technologies for both commercial and consumer uses. Among the projects under development is NBC Desktop News, a joint effort of I.B.M., NBC and the NuMedia Corporation, to provide news and specialized information on personal computers. I.B.M.'s new unit will be headquartered in Somers, N.Y., and will have an office in Mountain View, Calif.

title: Review/Theater; Revised 'Last Yankee,' With Focus on Wives
description: In "The Last Yankee" a major playwright, Arthur Miller, is writing in a minor key. More anecdotal than dramatic, the play, at the Manhattan Theater Club, is enhanced by the contribution of the cast, under the direction of John Tillinger. Basically the work is an overlapping slice of life about two disparate wives in contrasting but equally disastrous marriages. They are driven to the same end: a severe state of depression. Each case is in the nature of a case history, with the playwright diagnosing the illness and offering a litany of causes without fully investigating the roots of the shared problem or the marriages themselves. In each story, the husband would seem to bear much of the responsibility for his wife's depression.
