title: Company Briefs
description: ARCHER-DANIELS-MIDLAND CO., Des Moines, an agricultural products company, will pay a $1 million fine to settle a lawsuit over air and water pollution violations.

title: ARCO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 75 million related to the Iranian settlement. The gain was partially offset by charges for environmental-related obligations in the quarter and the year included a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 392,000,000.Latest share earnings are from the adoption of SFAS 106 and 109, which reduced earnings per share by $ 2.43 a share.Arco said the 1992 results also included a net after-tax benefit of $ 140 million. This net benefit related primarily to a gain from a settlement on assets nationalized by Iran and recognition of a previously deferred portion of the gain from the 1989 sale of a majority interest in Lyondell Petrochemical Co. common stock. This was partially offset by charges related to ARCO Chemical Co.'s withdrawal from a South Korean joint venture and charges for future environmental costs.The 1991 results included net after-tax charges of about $ 295 million related primarily to personnel reductions and property sales and writedowns.

title: Ancient Desert Rats Leave Clues To Kaleidoscope of Climate Change
description: THOUGH hardly as glamorous as dinosaur skeletons or fossil-bearing amber, crystallized rat urine has found a place as a window through which scientists are glimpsing fresh details of the earth's environmental history.

title: The Basement Sacked Talley
description: Either Darryl Talley is a great storyteller, or he is incredibly accident-prone.

title: No Mutant Tomatoes For Campbell Soup
description: To the Editor:

title:
Review/Television;
Old Pitchers Never Die, They Go on Car Trips
description: An easygoing movie called "Cooperstown" -- on TNT this evening at 8, 10 and midnight -- attempts the seemingly impossible: to concoct a baseball story without becoming mired in sentimental sludge. That it largely succeeds, right up to the inevitable final scene of teary uplift, is quite remarkable. A choice cast and the supple direction of Charles Haid help immeasurably, as does a screenplay by the playwright Lee Blessing ("A Walk in the Woods").

title: Diamond Shamrock reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss from an accounting adjustment of $ 17,700,000.

title: Amerada Hess reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included corporate charges, net of earnings from other operating activities, of $ 5.4 million for both the quarter and year, and the quarter also included income tax refunds and related interest of $ 25.4 million, or 29 cents a share.c-Net loss and included corporate charges, net of earnings from other operating activities, of $ 18.1 million in both the quarter and year, and the year also included income tax refunds and related interest of $ 54.4 million, or 67 cents a share.d-Included $ 46.2 million from the settlement of litigation related to natural gas sales contracts.Shares outstanding reflects the weighted average effect of the issuance of 11.5 million shares in June 1992.

title: Japanese Stocks Rally
description: Stocks moved higher today on hopes of Government assistance for the sluggish economy. The 225-share Nikkei index gained 205.18 points, or 1.26 percent, to 16,492.63. On Monday, the Nikkei lost 49.36 points.

title: SFFed Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income of $ 4 million, or 51 cents a share, from the adoption of a new method of accounting for income taxes.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Concert Royal Florence Gould Hall

title: Advanced Marketing reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Marekt System.

title: Sports of The Times; Silver Fox In the Shark Tank
description: ROLLIE MASSIMINO leaned back in one of the plastic seats in Thomas and Mack Arena and reflected on his new lease on life at the University of Nevada-Las Vegas.

title: Oil Prices Are Up Sharply On Possible Cuts by OPEC
description: Crude oil for delivery in March soared to a three-week high, after Saudi Arabia and Iran, OPEC's largest producers, said they would be willing to lower production to halt plunging prices, which have fallen 20 percent since October.

title: A Trip Straight Out of Brooklyn To the Sundance Film Festival
description: Leslie Harris, the director and screenwriter of "Just Another Girl on the IRT," sat in a nondescript coffeehouse this morning on Main Street of this lush ski resort, staring at the snow-covered slopes and the army of skiers parading past.

title: Philadelphia Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said that the 1991 results for the quarter and year were reclassified to reflect adoption of FERC Accounting Release 14.The latest quarter included charge of 5 cents a share for costs of an anticipated reduction of about 600 jobs in its nuclear power group.The latest year included charge of 27 cents a share to settle litigation in connection with its Peach Bottom nuclear power plant and the 5 cent charge for the work force reduction.

title: Ohio Casualty reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Time Warner Plans Cable System of Hundreds of Channels
description: Time Warner Inc. announced plans yesterday for a highly sophisticated cable television system that would provide hundreds of channels and a vast library of entertainment and services that subscribers could call up on demand.

title: Britain Cuts Key Rate; Pound Falls
description: Britain dropped its benchmark lending rate today to its lowest level since 1977, causing the pound to fall against the German mark and the dollar and sending stocks up sharply in London.

title: Robert Harrington, 50, Astronomer in Capital
description: Dr. Robert S. Harrington, an astronomer with the United States Naval Observatory in Washington, died Saturday at George Washington University Hospital. He was 50 and lived in McLean, Va.

title: Baxter International reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 9,000,000, or 3 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 45,000,000, or 16 cents a share, in the year, and the year also included a charge of $ 165,000,000 from an accounting adjustment.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 22,000,000, or 8 cents a share, and $ 84,000,000, or 30 cents a share, in the quarter and year, respectively.

title: Suitor Starts Mapping Strategy to Save The Post
description: Steven Hoffenberg, the businessman who would be owner of The New York Post, scheduled his first meeting on the future of the imperiled newspaper with the head of the one department that he values above all others: sales.

title: Russian Sensitivities; As Choices Become Harder, Moscow Grows Skeptical About U.S. Policies
description: For Russia the conflicts in Iraq and Yugoslavia have posed an increasingly wrenching choice between traditional allies and a longing for a new partnership with Washington and the West.

title: Dinkins Tells Legislators Of Burdens
description: With more assertiveness than in past visits to Albany, Mayor David N. Dinkins today charged the state with shifting its financial problems onto the city in recent years, and pleaded for "a change of posture in Albany."

title: Review/Ballet; A Swan and a Firebird, And Their Princes
description: "Swan Lake" mania has obviously overtaken the New York City Ballet. Never have so many superb, and mainly new, leading casts been seen in the company's production in one season. Wendy Whelan and Nilas Martins were the latest to make their debuts as Odette and Siegfried, and they did so splendidly on Sunday afternoon at the New York State Theater.

title: U.N. Chief Threatens to Pull Troops Out of Angola
description: Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali recommended today that the Security Council set a deadline of April 30 for the warring parties in Angola to make peace, and said the Council should withdraw the United Nations peacekeepers if the deadline is not met.

title: Compaq Computer's Profit Jumped 34% in 4th Quarter
description: The sales and profit resurgence for the Compaq Computer Corporation continued in the fourth quarter.

title: No. 2 Bank To Spin Off Bad Assets
description: The BankAmerica Corporation appears to be finally digesting last year's acquisition of the Security Pacific Corporation, which had far more troubled assets than was expected.

title: Landmark Graphics reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Getting Ready for A Calmer Pose Now
description: Dan Reeves today wore his game-day outfit: a suit, tie, shirt, tassled shoes. The way he sees it, the outfit stops him from screaming on the sidelines.

title: What's a Roast? For Many Chefs It's Fish or Garlic or Bananas or . . .
description: ROASTING wafts through the senses. In culinary terms it is freighted with mouthwatering aroma, comforting warmth, a crisping sizzle and anticipated succulence. And lately it is more appreciated than ever.

title:
Commercial Property;
A Business-District Law Is Upheld in New Jersey
description: The concept of special improvement districts in New Jersey has received important legal support. Earlier this month a state superior court upheld the law allowing this community to create such a district, in which business property owners pay special assessments to finance special improvements and services to inject new life into a commercial hub.

title: Super Bowl XXVII: Notebook; Thomas Is Content to Let Bygones Be Bygones
description: When Coach Jimmy Johnson recruited running back Thurman Thomas to attend Oklahoma State in 1984, he went to Thomas's home in Missouri City, Tex., to talk with his mother.

title: Enron Oil & Gas reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: In 1992, net income benefited from tight gas sand federal income tax credit utilization of about $ 42.5 million, compared to $ 16.9 million in 1991.

title: Review/Opera; 'Il Trovatore': A Dark and Gloomy Night in Aragon
description: The Metropolitan Opera's five-year-old production of "Il Trovatore" is in trouble before a single player has set foot on stage. In his companion piece to "Rigoletto," Verdi let loose a torrent of abrasive energy. Written consecutively, the two operas share a relentless cruelty, thwarted revenge and a fascination for the physically grotesque. The cool economies of this Met staging, on the other hand, summon a kind of enameled gloom; the flow has been diffused, the temperatures lowered.

title: Military Cites Wide Range of Reasons for Its Gay Ban
description: Raised in the privacy of a two-hour White House meeting and in public debate, the military's objections to homosexuals' serving openly in the armed services are many. They range from visceral fears of disrupting a tight-knit culture and destroying decades-old tradition to practical questions of living in cramped quarters on a six-month sea tour.

title: Butler Manufacturing reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and included an aftertax restructuring charge of $ 4 million in both the quarter and year.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Chronicle
description: Did Oona O'Neill Chaplin sign a document that guaranteed a loan of $500,000 to Dr. CHRIST L. ZOIS, a New York psychiatrist? Or was the signature of Mrs. Chaplin -- widow of Charlie Chaplin and daughter of Eugene O'Neill -- forged?

title: Before We Step Into a Bosnian Quagmire
description: To the Editor:

title: First Lady and Top Official Visit, Both Named Hillary Clinton
description: On her first day in her new job shaping her husband's health-care plan, Hillary Rodham Clinton yesterday mixed private discussions on health policy with a public appearance scripted along the traditional lines of First Ladyhood: a visit to a public school in New York to chat with children in front of cameras.

title: 3 Aircraft Companies Announce Big Job Cutbacks as Orders Fall
description: Squeezed by fewer orders for military aircraft and commercial jet airliners, three major aerospace companies announced cutbacks yesterday that will result in layoffs of thousands of workers in coming months, with Connecticut and Washington State losing most of the jobs.

title: Under-Appreciated, Blood Oranges Claim a Place in the Sun
description: CRIMSON-FLESHED, intensely flavored blood oranges from Italy and California, the most delicious and alluring of citrus fruits, are now in peak season. Prized by connoisseurs for their complex, berry-like taste and distinctive appearance, but hindered on the market by their idiosyncrasies, blood oranges are gradually attaining the appreciation they deserve.

title: Baush & Lomb reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: b-Net lossc-Included charges of $ 63,291,000 for restructuring and other non-recurring costs which reduced earnings per share by $ 1.05 for both the quarter and year, and the year also included a loss of $ 58,311,000 related to change in accounting for post-retirement benefits.Fiscal 1991's income from continuing operations of $ 85,941,000, or $ 1.42 a share, included chages of $ 63,291,000 for restructuring and other non-recurring costs, which reduced share earnings by $ 1.05.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: ARCO ALASKA INC., Anchorage, said it and Phillips Petroleum led the bidding for oil and gas leases in Cook Inlet. Working as 60-40 partners, they bid up to $17 million for tracts. EQUITABLE COS., New York, will merge its money-management unit, Equitable Capital Management, with Alliance Capital Management L.P, a publicly traded company in which the Equitable Companies owns a 55 percent stake.

title: Augat Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and the year included restructuring costs of $ 22 million.

title: James River Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

title: Israel Rejects U.N. Chief's Proposals on Deportees
description: Israel, edging closer to a confrontation with the United Nations, today angrily rejected Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali's recommendation for Security Council measures to force the return of roughly 400 Palestinians deported to Lebanon six weeks ago.

title: PEOPLES WESTCHESTER BOARD REJECTS TAKEOVER BID
description: The board of the Peoples Westchester Savings Bank yesterday rejected the $30-a-share takeover bid it received from an investor group on Jan. 19. The groupnow owns a 9.9 percent stake. The bank's stock jumped $3 a share yesterday, to $36, in Nasdaq trading. Peoples Westchester also said it had received another letter from the group stating it was "open to adjusting" the proposed price after an examination of the company's financial statements. The investor group could not be reached for comment.

title: Fiserv Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Giants Came to Praise Reeves, but Will They Play for Him?
description: Although Lawrence Taylor and Phil Simms can take the escape route and reunite with Bill Parcells in New England, both said today their preference is to remain with the Giants.

title: 60-Minute Gourmet
description: DARK-FLESHED fish, like salmon, tuna and bluefish, can be enhanced by countless quick sauces, whether spicy, sweet or acidic. These fish have relatively high fat content that foils assertive sauces and garnishes, yielding a harmonious taste sensation.

title: Roadway Services reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Deluxe Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

description: To the Editor:

title: Israel Faces New U.N. Pressure Over Deportations
description: Accused of allowing the United Nations to adopt a double standard in its dealings with recalcitrant nations, Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali called today for the Security Council to take "whatever measures are necessary" to make Israel obey the Council's demand to re-admit 400 deported Palestinians.

title: Bids to Build Public Toilets Facing Limits
description: The Dinkins administration and the City Council plan to put conditions on a proposed city franchise for building public toilets that in effect would eliminate from competition a major European company that has tested its toilets successfully in New York.

title: Hershey Foods reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Wallace Fund Grants to Help Popularize Museums
description: The Lila Wallace-Reader's Digest Fund is to announce tomorrow a series of grants totaling $50 million over the next five years that are intended to help art museums attract more diverse audiences.

title: Hudson Leathers, 86, Commodity Executive
description: L. Hudson Leathers, whose career in the commodities business spanned more than six decades, died on Jan. 19 at Centrastate Medical Center in Freehold, N.J. He was 86 and had moved to Freehold from Orange, N.J., after he retired as a first vice president at Shearson Lehman Brothers two years ago.

title: Betz Laboratories reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Aaron Kellner Memorial
description: A memorial service for Dr. Aaron Kellner, founder and former president of the New York Blood Center and its Lindley F. Kimball Research Institute, who died on Dec. 12, will be held at 1 P.M. Friday in the center's auditorium at 310 East 67th Street in Manhattan.

title: Northern Telecom's Earnings Increase 23%
description: Partly by taking business away from A.T.& T. and other telecommunications rivals, Northern Telecom of Canada was able to report a 23 percent gain in fourth-quarter earnings, to $255.6 million, or $1.02 a share. Quarterly revenue rose 10 percent, to $2.54 billion, from $2.306 billion a year ago. All figures are in United States dollars.

title: Exar Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Havel Is Elected President of New Czech Republic by Its Parliament
description: Vaclav Havel, the playwright who led Czechoslovakia during its transition from Communism to democracy and campaigned in vain against the country's breakup, was elected to a five-year term today as President of the new Czech Republic.

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: Chronicle
description: On Monday afternoon, a group of women from an organization called Lesbian Agenda entered the Madison Avenue office of ALEXANDRA PENNEY, editor in chief of Self magazine, to protest the magazine's plans for an event in Aspen, Colo., next week. Many groups are boycotting Colorado because of a proposal there to bar laws that protect the rights of gay men and lesbians. On Jan. 15, a state judge in Denver temporarily blocked Colorado from enforcing the anti-gay rights measure.

title: Books of The Times; The Inside Tales of a Media Empire
description: Murdoch By William Shawcross Illustrated. 492 pages. Simon & Schuster. $27.50.

title: EX-CHIEF DENIES REPORT HE PLANS TO QUIT G.M. BOARD
description: Roger B. Smith, the former chairman and chief executive of the General Motors Corporation, is denying a report that he has agreed to resign from the auto maker's board. The Washington Post, in today's issue, said Mr. Smith will retire from the board when his term ends in May. "That's news to me," Mr. Smith said in a telephone interview late last night. He added that he had told members of G.M.'s nominating committee several times that he will serve "until they no longer want me."

title: City Opera Announces 3 World Premieres
description: The New York City Opera is to celebrate its 50th-anniversary season with a schedule that is weighted toward the contemporary, especially American works that have long been considered the company's greatest strengths. The centerpiece of the season is a World Premiere Festival, in October, which includes Ezra Laderman's "Marilyn" (an opera about Marilyn Monroe); Hugo Weisgall's "Esther" (about the biblical heroine), and a new version of Lukas Foss's television opera "Griffelkin" (based on a Grimm fairy tale).

title: Reeves Arrives as Giants Finally Get Their Man
description: Dan Reeves became the Giants' head coach today after a month of torment for the team that so recently ruled professional football.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: John R. Brown, 83, Federal Judge Who Ordered Integration in South
description: John R. Brown, a Federal judge who played a major role in desegregation cases that transformed the South, died Friday at a hospital in Houston. He was 83 and lived in Houston.

title: Baird Stands in Part for All Working Mothers; Who Is Without Sin?
description: To the Editor:

title: Job-Stimulus Plan Begins to Take Shape
description: Aides to President Clinton said that he would probably propose $15 billion to $20 billion in new Federal spending this year to stimulate employment.

title: USLICO STOCK DROPS 20% AFTER DIVIDEND IS SLASHED
description: Shares of the USLico Corporation fell 20 percent yesterday, after the insurance holding company said it would take charges equal to $6.68 a share and cut its dividend to 6 cents from 25 cents. USLico shares dropped $3.875, to $15.375, on the New York Stock Exchange, where its percentage decline was the sharpest of the day. Daniel Callahan 3d, who became chairman in October, said that the charges of $71.9 million, announced late Monday, were balance sheet write-offs that would not affect operations. The charges will result in a fourth-quarter loss and a loss for 1992.

title: Washington-Area Students Take Lead in Annual Science Awards
description: High school students from outside the New York metropolitan area, particularly those in the Washington area, overtook New Yorkers this year in the 52d annual Westinghouse Science Talent Search, whose 40 finalists were named Monday. New York State produced 7 finalists, 13 fewer than last year. Four are from New York City schools, which had 11 in 1992.

title: FMC Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 73,200,000 in both the quarter and year, and the year also included an extraordinary charge of $ 11,400,000 related to restructuring debt and a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 183,700,000, which reflects after-tax charge resulting from the early adoption of acounting standard 106 (post-retirement benefits).c-Net income and the year included an extraordinary charge of $ 9,200,000 related to restructuring debt.

title: Bank Rates Slide a Bit Across U.S.
description: Yields offered on bank money market accounts and certificates of deposit for the week beginning today dipped slightly, according to The Bank Rate Monitor, a Florida-based newsletter.

title: WNYC Sues to Keep Spot on Cable Dial
description: Several cable television channels in Manhattan are to be switched on Monday, but WNYC, the public television station operated by the New York City government, has filed a lawsuit to hold up the realignment.

title: Toyota Dealers Plan Comedy Festivals
description: Laughter is not usually associated with buying a car. Toyota dealer associations in metropolitan New York and Philadelphia hope to change that by sponsoring comedy festivals in May and June.

title: Hazing's Forbidden Rites Are Moving 'Underground'
description: For generations, fraternities and sororities have been seen as organizations that help students develop a sense of belonging on college campuses. That was the reason Derone Walker pledged the Phi Beta Sigma fraternity last year at Southern University in Baton Rouge, La.

title: Review/Television; A Real Live Health-Care Drama
description: Many a lawyer must be an actor manque. But Prof. Arthur Miller of the Harvard Law School is demonstrably not to the manque born. His thespiantic talents have been displayed in many upscale television discussions, and now, in "Who Shall Be Healed?," he has the hit of his performing career.

title: Super Bowl XXVII; . . . While the Bills' Smith Is the Calm Rather Than the Storm
description: Bruce Smith behaved himself. He said "thank you." He said "you're welcome." To reporters. To photographers. To people who stuck tape recorders into his face and tried to get him angry, tried to get him to explode. Smith didn't bite.

title: UNITED TECHNOLOGIES CORP. (N)
description: Accounting changes and special charges reflecting the costs of reducing employment and closing factories produced losses in both the fourth quarter and the year for the United Technologies Corporation.

title: U.S. Suspends Dredging Permit for Newark Bay
description: A permit allowing port officials to begin dredging container-ship berths in Newark Bay, a project vital to the survival of waterfront commerce in New York Harbor, was abruptly suspended this month by one Federal agency, only a week after it had been approved by another.

title: Public & Private; Welcome to the Club
description: The children watching the inauguration being replayed on tape grew silent as Maya Angelou began to recite her poem. Then midway through they began to cheer, not for her words but for themselves, as though she were calling the roll: So say the Asian, the Hispanic, the Jew The African, the Native American, the Sioux,

title: TOPPS STOCK PLUMMETS 30% ON EXPECTED LOSS
description: The Topps Company, the nation's leading maker of sports and entertainment trading cards, lost 30.6 percent of its market value amid concern that demand for its products is declining. It stock fell $3.75 yesterday, to $8.50, in Nasdaq trading. Topps, based in Brooklyn, said it expected a loss in the fourth quarter, which ends on Feb. 26.

title: American Express's Third Man
description: The new leadership team at the American Express Company -- James D. Robinson 3d as chairman and Harvey Golub as chief executive -- emerged victorious Monday only after a search committee of five board members failed to find an alternative choice to Mr. Golub.

title: Caterpillar Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 2.6 million from adoption of SFAS 109.

title: 2 Acquitted of Rape Charge
description: Two former Arkansas football players were acquitted of rape charges yesterday in Fayetteville, Ark., after a jury heard the defendants deny having sex with a teen-age girl who said she consented to the acts.

title: U.S. Moves Ahead on War-Crimes Tribunal
description: The State Department has taken the first step toward organizing an international tribunal to prosecute war crimes in the Balkans, senior Administration officials said today.

title: Ferro Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a restructuring charge of $ 31.7 million.

title: Sports of The Times; Welcome To the N.F.C. Beast
description: NOW that Dan Reeves is finally the Giants' coach, he is either being diplomatic or he has made his first mistake.

title: Correction: Nougat Semifreddo
description: An article in The Living Section on Jan. 6 about restaurants in Italy where women are in charge of the kitchens gave incomplete instructions for nougat semifreddo. Here is the corrected recipe. (Adapted from Claudia Verro, La Contea restaurant, Neive, Italy) Total time: 1 1/2 hours, plus overnight for freezing 1 pound shelled hazelnuts 8 eggs, separated 1 1/3 cups sugar 1/2 cup water 2 cups whipping cream, chilled.

title: Lawmakers Convene Committee on Change
description: A joint Senate-House committee that was created last year to recommend ways of reorganizing Congress convened for the first time today, and the ideas offered by Democratic leaders who testified before the panel were in sharp conflict with those of their Republican counterparts.

title: GRC International reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Wine Talk
description: THE last vintage chart to appear in this space, on May 22, 1991, documented one of the more memorable periods in wine history. From 1981, the first vintage covered, through 1990, which had not yet been bottled, it was a period of unrivaled prosperity and success in most of the major wine regions of the world.

title: Shaky Knicks Manage 4th in Row
description: Listening to Pat Riley's post-game comments, it sounded like the Knicks had lost. And certainly, the Knicks played poorly enough to lose, committing 20 turnovers and shooting 42.9 percent from the field.

title: COCA-COLA RESUMING REGULAR SALES IN SAUDI ARABIA
description: The Coca-Cola Company said yesterday that it would resume regular sales in Saudi Arabia after 25 years. The announcement appeared to mark the formal end of an Arab boycott against the Atlanta-based company imposed in 1967 in the aftermath of the Arab-Israeli war. Arab League nations barred several major American corporations that had business ties with Israel from their countries. Coca-Cola has been imported into Saudi Arabia in limited quantities since the boycott was eased in 1989. Under a new agreement, Coca-Cola, Diet Coke, Fanta and Sprite will be produced in cans and post-mix at the Coca-Cola Bottling Company of Saudi Arabia.

title: Brooklyn Philharmonic Reaches Pact
description: The Brooklyn Philharmonic, one of the nine orchestras affected by the strike of freelance musicians, which began on Saturday, reached a separate tentative agreement yesterday with Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians, the union representing the players. The orchestra's musicians are meeting today to vote on the new three-year contract.

title: Crawford & Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shares outstanding included class A and class B common shares outstanding.

title: Recalling a Friend, No Matter His Name
description: With a blanket of flowers and his weather-beaten hat atop the coffin, Travis -- the homeless man who lived in and around the Central Park boathouse for more than a decade and became friend, protector and resident philosopher for scores of park regulars -- was buried yesterday in a wooded cemetery in East Hanover, N.J.

title: John A. Lafore Jr., 87, Kennel Club President
description: John A. Lafore Jr., a former president of the American Kennel Club and a former Congressman from Pennsylvania, died Sunday at Lankeanau Hospital in Montgomery County, Pa. He was 87 and lived in Villanova, Pa.

title: Apple South reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.All share earnings are adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split distributed Nov. 17, 1992, but before the effect of a 3-for-2 stock split, which will be distributed on Feb. 9.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: NEW YORK CITY CHANCELLOR SOFTENS RAINBOW CURRICULUM

title: The Pop Life
description: Watching Germany

title: Personal Health
description: THE story is one that is echoed daily in hospitals and nursing homes throughout the country. As Nancy Neveloff Dubler, a bioethicist at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx, tells it, the patient was an 83-year-old former piano teacher with diabetes who had lost one leg, was blind in one eye and nearly blind in the other and had such severe arthritis that he could no longer play the piano. He was confined to his home in a wheelchair, aided by a 24-hour home attendant and visiting nurses.

title: Uncovered Short Sales Increase by About 2% on Nasdaq
description: The number of Nasdaq shares sold short and not yet covered rose slightly from mid-December to mid-January, the National Association of Securities Dealers said yesterday.

title: A Steaming, Fragrant Gratin to Chase Away Midwinter's Chill
description: COLD weather is gratin season for me. There is something about a hot gratin emerging from the oven and perfuming the entire house that warms my senses as well as my stomach.

title: A Sweet Sauce for Chicken
description: CHICKEN takes kindly to almost any flavoring because it has so little taste of its own. This sweet orange-apricot marinade can be used with all chicken parts.

title: Dow Holds On to Finish Ahead 6.75 in Heavy Trading
description: The bond market took back its recent gifts to stock investors yesterday afternoon, as the credit market's selloff abruptly ended a rally in stocks, leaving them narrowly ahead.

title: Rockies Dismiss 2 Owners
description: The Colorado Rockies yesterday dismissed JOHN ANTONUCCI and STEVE EHRHART , two of the team's three original owners who lost much of their authority in a restructuring last fall.

title: Nelson Shields 3d, 69, Gun-Control Advocate
description: Nelson T. Shields 3d, a founder of the advocacy group Handgun Control, died Monday at his home in Greenville, Del. He was 69.

title: Ruble at More than 500 to Dollar As Plunge Spurs Fear of Inflation
description: The value of the Russian ruble plunged today by more than 13 percent in trading at the Moscow currency exchange, breaking a 500-ruble-to-the-dollar barrier, an event widely seen as a signal of looming hyperinflation.

title: Market Place; Chrysler stock is on the rise despite threat of dilution.
description: THE Chrysler Corporation's rebound has been nowhere more evident than in the vitality of its common stock. The shares rose steadily in the last week despite the auto maker's decision to try to raise perhaps as much as $1.5 billion by offering 40 million new shares.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Chase Manhattan Corp., New York, is offering $200 million of subordinated notes due in 2003 at 100 to yield 7.5 percent through Salomon Brothers. The noncallable notes are rated Baa-3 by Moody's Investors Service and Bbb by Standard & Poor's Corp.

title: USX-Delhi Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 17.9 million from the cumulative effect of adopting FAS 109.c-Net loss and included an $ 18.7 million pretax impairment of a partnership investment.Share earnings were not applicable in the latest year and 1991.Earnings are pro forma, based on the assumption that the new capital structure of the Delhi Group as of June 30, 1992, was in effect as of Jan. 1, 1991.

title: Richfood Holdings reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 9
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Daly Predicts Better Things    JOHN DALY said today in Scottsdale, Ariz., that he expected to be a better player after three and a half weeks of treatment for alcohol abuse, but added that he was not expecting too much out of his game right away.
description: "I think that when you quit drinking, mentally you're a 100 percent person, right there," Daly said during a news conference at the Phoenix Open, where he will return to the tour tomorrow.

title: Torcolato Wine, Italy's Sweet Secret
description: IN this town north of Venice near Vicenza, in an area known for the clean lines and classic proportions of its Palladian villas, the wine of note is a decidedly baroque confection. Torcolato, which means twisted, is a wine made from grapes left to dry on giant, corkscrew strands hung from attic ceilings.

title: Feinstein Makes Bid For Judge's Removal In Corruption Case
description: Barry Feinstein, one of New York's most powerful union leaders, said yesterday that the administrative judge hearing civil corruption charges against him had dictated the terms of a plea-bargaining settlement and then abruptly rejected the agreement.

title: A Safe Haven for Hamas in America
description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin's deportation of 413 activists to Lebanon represented not only retaliation for murders but also was intended as a pre-emptive strike to curb the rise in terrorism by followers of the Islamic Resistance Movement, or Hamas.

title: At P.S. 115, Urban Reality Is Only Pushed Aside
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton thrilled Public School 115 with her lightning visit yesterday, but minutes after her departure, students were back in mourning for a teacher who may have been murdered, and the principal was worrying that more school ceilings will collapse.

title: Vulcan Materials reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income of $ 3,005,000, or 8 cents a share, from the adoption of new income tax accounting standards.c-Net lossd-Included charges of $ 23.6 million in the quarter and $ 26 million in the year, related to impairment and liquidation of certain assets.

title: Editorial Notebook; The President's Other Running Mate
description: According to the columnist William Safire, the phrase "first Lady in the Land" was popularized during the Civil War in an 1863 book by William Howard Russell, war correspondent of The Times of London. It instantly took wing, and Hillary Clinton is now 42d in a line that began with Martha Washington (two Presidents remarried in office, Jefferson was a widower, Buchanan a bachelor).

title: McDonald & Co. Invest.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Raychem Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and reflected payment of previously reported settlement of a securities class action lawsuit in December 1991. The settlement was for $ 19.5 million; $ 8.25 million paid by Raychem and $ 11.25 million paid by its insurer.

title: Dead Sea Scrolls To Be Displayed At 2 Libraries
description: Some of the best-preserved and least-viewed fragments of the Dead Sea Scrolls, which have been objects of religious veneration and of venomous scholarly debate, will go on display at the Library of Congress in April, the first major American exhibition of the Scrolls in a generation.

title: ENRON CORP. (N)
description: Higher prices fattened profits for the natural gas industry in the fourth quarter, and provided a feast for the industry's biggest diversified company, the Enron Corporation. The Houston-based company traced a portrait of broad-based improvement in its business units.

title: Two-Year Pact for Maddux
description: The Mets eliminated the possibility of their most problematic arbitration case of the off season yesterday when they came to an agreement with reliever Mike Maddux on a two-year contract.

title: New England Electric System reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Gloom Deepens As Layoffs Increase; More Job Losses at Pratt & Whitney
description: Pratt & Whitney's decision to shrink its Connecticut work force by one-third during the next two years promises to ricochet through an economy already battered by deep cuts in military spending and layoffs in the insurance industry. It will also mow down, at least for now, the hope for recovery from one of the worst local recessions in the nation, economists said.

title: Issues Beyond X's and O's
description: Problems Reeves Faced in Denver Control: It was his way, every step of the way. He has acted as his own general manager for football operations, and has run the college draft as well. But the issue flared after the 1991 season when he fired Mike Shanahan, his offensive coordinator, in a disagreement over how the offense should be run. Even though Reeves had hired Shanahan and given him the title, he didn't want him to have control.

title: Coach Portrayed: A Brainy Battler
description: Good guy or bad guy? Uptight or relaxed? Players' dream or players' nightmare?

title: Dr. Samuel S. Cohen, Surgeon, 79
description: Dr. Samuel S. Cohen, an orthopedic surgeon for more than 50 years, died on Friday at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in Manhattan. He was 79 and lived in Manhattan and Southold, L.I.

title: Reports Show How the Books Are Kept
description: In contrast to the image of the Towers Financial Corporation that is sketched by Steven Hoffenberg and his supporters, the fine print in the company's annual reports shows a concern whose explosive growth has been accompanied by some unusual accounting arrangements and an uneven compliance with its legal obligations to its investors.

title: Ex-Vermont Governor for Education Post
description: Madeleine M. Kunin, who emphasized education when she was Governor of Vermont, has become the latest former Governor chosen to help lead the United States Department of Education.

title: Book Notes
description: Republicans' Memoirs

title: Scott Paper Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: b-Net loss and included a net charge of $ 2.49 a share for special items related to the company's business improvement program. Excluding special items, earnings per share for the fourth quarter and year were 35 cents and $ 1.54 respectively.The latest periods' share earnings included a gain of 12 cents in the quarter and 48 cents in the year from the net effect of accounting changes related to depreciation and postretirement benefits.

title: Super Bowl XXVII; Cowboy Irvin Makes Himself a Center of Attention . . .
description: Michael Irvin's initial move this week was to pilfer his interview-room nameplate. "Hey, man, I'm sorry, but I'm keeping my first Super Bowl name tag," he said, sliding it into his silk shirt pocket. He then removed his designer sunglasses -- which cost more than most car payments -- and waved the swarm of microphones toward him.

title: United Illuminating reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 7,337,000 from cumulative change in accounting for property taxes.

title: Tokyo Stocks Up a Bit
description: Stocks were slightly higher here today. The Nikkei index of 225 issues closed up 17.05 points, or 0.1 percent, at 16,509.68. On Tuesday, the Nikkei gained 205.18 points.

title: Tainted Hamburger Raises Doubts on Meat Safety
description: At Children's Hospital here, a 9-year-old girl is hanging on to life by a thread after eating tainted hamburger. A 2-year-old boy has already died, and 16 other children are being treated for severe illness brought on by the same contaminated meat.

title: Hi-Lo Automotive reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge related to refinancing of bank debt of $ 1,200,000.

title: Baird Stands in Part for All Working Mothers
description: To the Editor:

title: Boston College Ends St. John's Streak at 5
description: He didn't even make the blackboard.

title: Penske Adds Tracy as No. 2
description: As expected, Penske Racing yesterday announced that the Canadian driver PAUL TRACY will replace the retired RICK MEARS as its second Indy-car driver. Tracy, 24, is known for a flat-out driving style that is exciting to watch but hard on equipment.

title: Eating Well
description: FOR many Americans there is an urgent reason to drink water from a bottle: lead. The February issue of Consumer Reports says that for many, the greatest source of lead is the water that flows through their own faucets.

title: Bill O' Rights Lite
description: With quiet efficiency, the first 10 amendments to the Constitution have been profoundly revised by the state and Federal judiciary during the last couple decades, sparing us the untidy political melee of a constitutional convention. In light of these changes, a new Bill of Rights, based on current case law, might look something like what follows.AMENDMENT I.

title: Oil Is In Again
description: Oil stocks, recently out of fashion, became the latest rage after some Saudi trend-setters talked about limiting oil output. Exxon, off more than 5 percent this year through last week, recovered with the added impetus of a healthy earnings report. As a group, the oil stocks have now caught up to the S.&P. 500's 1 percent gain this year.

title: Food Notes
description: Julia Child's 80th

title: Webb (Del) Corp. (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included extraordinary income of $ 750,000, or 5 cents a share, from the extinguishment of debt, in the quarter and 6 months.

description: b-Included charge of $ 135.4 million for adoption of SFAS 106, and charge of $ 37.2 million for adoption of SFAS 112.c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $ 9.4 million and $ 12.4 million, in the quarter and year, respectively.The company said it took $ 123.8 million in restructuring charges, for closing of a ceiling materials plant in Belgium and for ''continuing elimination of salaried employee positions worldwide.'' For 1991, restructuring charges totaled $ 8.4 million.Sales represented net sales.

title: LAWMAKERS REVOLT ON LIFTING GAY BAN IN MILITARY SERVICE
description: Congressional resistance to President Clinton's promise to let homosexuals serve in the military broke into open revolt today, threatening to derail Democratic plans for quick passage of family-leave and health legislation.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: Congress to Tell Greenspan To Keep Interest Rates Low
description: With economic growth finally picking up and short-term interest rates at their lowest level in three decades, Alan Greenspan, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, might expect to be hugged when he testifies before Congress on Wednesday and Thursday.

title: More Colorful Bridges
description: To the Editor:

title: 'Chutzpah Therapy' for New Yorkers
description: AS Joyce Barrie sees it, people in New York are not nearly as outrageous as they ought to be.

title: San Diego Gas & Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Canada Seeks an Exemption As U.S. Prepares Steel Duties
description: As the Commerce Department put the finishing touches on preliminary new steel import tariffs, Canadian officials said today that they were attempting to win an exemption for Canadian steel from the Clinton Administration.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Monday about Transitchek, a program in the New York area that subsidizes the commuting costs of a company's employees, misstated the processing fee charged by Transit Center, the agency that runs the program. It is 4 percent.

title: Forget the Theories, Japan Puts Chaos to Work
description: In research laboratories around the world, chaos theory, a young scientific field that seeks to find order amid seemingly random behavior, is providing fundamental insights into the behavior of the weather, the inner workings of the human body and the ebb and flow of wildlife populations. In Japan, chaos theory is also being used to make a kerosene heater.

title: Review/Music; Focus Festival Concert Hammers at Boundaries
description: If there was any inference to be had from the first concert of Juilliard's Focus festival of contemporary music on Monday night, it was that Western Europe may no longer be the dominant center of art-music culture. In fact there may be as much confusion, disarray and experimentation in Europe as here in the United States, as many attempts to break down boundaries between pop, folk, jazz and art-music traditions as there are here, as little interest in subtle intellectual constructions, and about the same proportions of meretricious, banal and intriguing works.

title: The Urgency of Aiding Russia
description: President Clinton has appointed a fresh team to handle the nation's most important foreign challenge: to help a disintegrating Russia move to democracy and markets without threatening the safety of its neighbors. Now the team needs to inject new urgency into an economic aid program that languished under his predecessor.

title: HBO & Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net lossc-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 4,000 in the quarter and $ 544,000 in the year, and the year also included a pre-tax charge of $ 10,883,000.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Baird Stands in Part for All Working Mothers; Paperwork Nightmare
description: To the Editor:

title: Review/Film; Film Noir Still Has Life in the 90's, With Guns and a Snake Handler
description: That there's life for film noir in the 1990's is stunningly apparent in "Guncrazy," the very accomplished, cruelly entertaining new movie opening today at the Film Forum. As its murderous young lovers it stars James Le Gros ("My New Gun") and Drew Barrymore, who gives the kind of performance that can transform a sweetly competent actress into a major screen personality.

title: Sabatini's Comeback Foils Pierce's Bid
description: Mary Pierce will not be playing in her first Grand Slam semifinal this week. Gabriela Sabatini just barely wrested that precious opportunity away in the wee hours this morning with perhaps the most memorable of her many comebacks.

title: Let's Tip the Balance Back From Automobiles to Pedestrians
description: To the Editor:

title: No Headline
description: I was my mother's third choice, too. I don't feel any less loved than the rest of them. It doesn't make a difference with me. The main thing is that I'm their last choice. DAN REEVES, the Giants' new coach, who was the team's third choice for the job. [ B7:5. ]

title: Trident Microsystems reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

description: b-Included charge of $ 2.5 million, including $ 1.4 million related to expenses associated with the suspended Alliant Techsystems transaction and the writedown of a facility, and with $ 1.1 million related to the writedown of an asset in the quarter; the year included a charge of $ 45.6 million, which reflected adoption of FASB No. 106 and 109.c-Net loss and included restructuring charge of $ 80.4 million.Year-ago fourth quarter's results included a restructuring charge equaled to 15 cents a share.

title: CAMPBELL PRESSES BID FOR AUSTRALIAN COMPANY
description: The Campbell Soup Company said yesterday that it had increased its stake in Arnotts Ltd., a major Australian food company, to 35.4 percent, adding that this entitled it to a third seat on Arnotts' board. Campbell is making a hostile takeover attempt for Arnotts. It has offered $6.41, United States, a share. It said it acquired 1.5 million more shares yesterday and early today.

title: Bert Andrews, 63, Dies; Chronicled Black Theater
description: Bert Andrews, a performing-arts photographer whose pioneering work chronicled the history of the black theater since the 1950's, died on Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan. He was 63.

title: Drug Giants Show Gains In Earnings
description: Two large drug companies, Merck and Warner-Lambert, announced double-digit earnings growth yesterday, but investors seemed preoccupied with national trends that may limit future pharmaceutical profits. Drug stock prices have been declining on reports that the Clinton Administration expects to produce a national health-care program by May.

title: Clinton Names First Envoy, An Ambassador to Moscow
description: President Clinton has chosen Thomas R. Pickering, a top career diplomat, as his Ambassador to Russia, the White House announced today.

title: Cynthia Wood Is Dead; Patron of Arts Was 55
description: Cynthia Wood, a horse breeder and patron of the arts, died on Saturday at her ranch in Santa Barbara. She was 55.

title: Tie Domi Has Landed In Hostile Territory
description: Tie Domi, former Ranger avenger, hit the ground running last night at Kennedy Airport. The Winnipeg team had arrived, team bags were claimed, and then Domi was off with a friend to enjoy his old town.

title: More Change Likely at Shearson
description: With James D. Robinson 3d at the helm, Shearson Lehman Brothers faces yet another round of changes that could result in the firm being owned by public shareholders, if it survives an almost certain battle of egos, Wall Street executives said yesterday.

title: Article 314293 -- No Title
description: The Clinton Administration, confronting a new round of huge layoffs in some leading American industries, said today that the President was likely to propose $15 billion to $20 billion in additional Federal spending this year to stimulate job growth.

title: Tranquil Campus of C.I.A. Is Shaken by Killings of Two
description: The employees at the Central Intelligence Agency know the world is a dangerous place. Many spend their working hours analyzing the threats that make it that way, while others travel to dangerous places abroad to collect information.

title: Man Is Found Slain On Midtown N Train
description: An unidentified man was found stabbed to death on a southbound N train last night in the station at 34th Street and Sixth Avenue, the transit police reported.

title: International Technology reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a loss from disposition of pollution control manufacturing of $ 3,809,000 in both the quarter and 9 months, and a gain which reflects adoption of SFAS 109, Accounting for Income Taxes of $ 13,000,000, or 39 cents a share.c-Net incomed-Included income from pollution control manufacturing of $ 1,498,000, or 5 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 2,953,000, or 8 cents a share, in the 9 months.Latest quarter's loss from continuing operations of $ 4,346,000 and 9 months' income from continuing operations of $ 2,571,000, or 8 cents a share, both included charges of $ 6,300,000 related to the anticipated settlement of stockholders litigation and $ 1,981,000 related to the writeoff of costs invested in a U.K. joint venture. The 9 months included a gain of $ 3,483,000 from the sale of stock options of Exel Ltd. in the first quarter of 1993.Year-ago 9 month's income from continuing operations of $ 15,568,000, or 47 cents a share, included a $ 7,285,000 gain from the sale of Exel common stock.

title: Mylan Labs reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings were adjusted to reflect 2-for-1 stock split effective Aug. 1, 1992.

title: Amtrak to Test New Tilt Train
description: Amtrak said today that it would soon begin a three-month test of a "tilt technology" passenger train capable of speeds up to 155 miles an hour on its Northeast express corridor.

description: b-Included a charge of $ 331 million on an accounting change from the adoption of SFAS 106 and SFAS 109.USX Corp. said that the beginning with the fourth quarter of 1992, the Marathon Group results excluded the results of the businesses of the recently formed Delhi Group, except for a retained interest, initially 36 percent, in Delhi Group's income and net assets.Delhi Group sales accounted for about 3 percent of Marathon Group sales for the first 9 months of 1992. Net proceeds of $ 136 million from the sale in October 1992 of 9 million shares of USX-Delhi Group common stock were reflected in their entirety in the Marathon Group financial statements.

title: Logicon Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Regan Assails Jobs Program For Prisoners
description: The New York State Comptroller charged today that a state program that provides jobs and vocational training for prison inmates is oversubscribed and undersupervised, resulting in too many inmate escapes and re-arrests.

title: Corrections
description: An obituary headline in some editions on Monday and in some yesterday, about John Corbin Eddison, an expert on economic development, misstated his age. He was 73.

title: U.N. Arms Experts Begin New Search in Iraq
description: United Nations nuclear and ballistic weapons inspectors completed their first day of work here today with the cooperation of the Iraqi authorities.

description: b-Included a pre-tax provision of $ 2,152,000 for the costs of a disposition for both the quarter and 6 months.

title: EUROPE PLANNING CURBS ON TANKERS
description: The European Community has decided to draw up strict new safety rules for oil tankers to reduce the risk of large oil spills like those off Spain and Britain in the last two months.

title: Super Bowl XXVII; Headlines, Headlines? Thomas Just Sighs
description: Wedged into a plastic yellow seat in the stands behind home plate at Dodger Stadium and surrounded by a mob of reporters, Bills running back Thurman Thomas had no place to run from the inevitable this afternoon.

title: Treasury Bond Prices in Retreat
description: Treasury bond prices yesterday gave back two-thirds of the gains made on Monday, as investors took profits. Corporate bonds also eased.

title: Doctors Report Signs of Progress In Patient Who Got Baboon Liver
description: The baboon liver that was transplanted into a 62-year-old man in Pittsburgh 16 days ago is growing to near human size and its functioning is improving, his doctors said yesterday.

title: Fernandez Modifies Parts of Curriculum About Gay Parents
description: New York City Schools Chancellor Joseph A. Fernandez has moved to end a long, bitter dispute over teaching first graders to be tolerant of families headed by gay and lesbian couples, softening controversial passages of his Rainbow Curriculum.

title: College Hockey Report
description: Sprint to Playoffs Just about every coach is telling his charges that the next five weeks will be crucial, that they can gain the home-ice advantage in the playoffs if they pull up their socks, tighten their belts and renew their dedication and commitment.

title: Hillary Rodham Clinton's Job
description: It's official. Hillary Rodham Clinton will not bake cookies, keep to the East Wing or stand quietly by her man. No, she will stand with her man, or maybe ahead of him, in formulating health care policy.

title: Review/Fashion; At Chanel, Couture Has a New Feeling
description: Karl Lagerfeld added plastic to the haute couture fabrics he used for his Chanel collection because he thought it was fun. Emanuel Ungaro invented a never-never land for his fairy-tale clothes, and Philippe Venet pursued his simple classics in a low key. Each interpreted the couture concept in an individual manner as the spring and summer fashion shows continued today.

title: I.B.M. TO REPLACE ITS TOP EXECUTIVE
description: I.B.M. announced yesterday that it was starting a search to replace its chief executive, John F. Akers, within three months. The company also cut its dividend payments to shareholders for the first time in its 79-year history, reducing the quarterly payout to 54 cents from $1.21.

title: Consolidated Edison Co. of New York Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Wenzhou Journal; Backed by China, Go-Getters Get Rich
description: If Mao Zedong were to come back to life and inspect this flourishing city of Dickensian capitalism, where privately owned factories hire migrant laborers to work 12 hours a day, seven days a week, he might be goaded intostarting a Communist revolution.

title: Islanders Making a Play for Playoffs by Playing .500
description: The New York subdivision of the Patrick Division is a tightly knit neighborhood too close for anyone's comfort. There ought to be a zoning law against so many pretty good teams being so near and yet so near.

description: b-Included gain of $ 4 million from settlement of property damage claim.

title: U.N. Says, 'Stop Shooting!' But Croats Shoot Anyway
description: Defying a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for them to withdraw, Croatian forces pressed ahead today in their offensive against Serbian militiamen near the Adriatic port city of Zadar, United Nations officials said today.

title: Bridge
description: If one wants to find the country with the highest percentage of top-class bridge players relative to the size of the population, one should look in the North Atlantic. Iceland's long winter nights, combined with a cold climate, make indoor games very popular. In 1991 one Icelandic team won the world teams title in Yokohama, Japan, and six months ago a completely different Icelandic squad won the Nordic Teams in Umea, Sweden, in a field that included world-class squads from Sweden and Denmark.

title: DIGITAL WILL CLOSE FACTORY IN MASSACHUSETTS
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation said yesterday that it planned to sell a 535,000-square-foot plant in Westfield, Mass. The sale is part of Digital's efforts to divest itself of nonessential manufacturing operations . The factory makes metal boxes that enclose computer parts. Digital said it wanted to sell the plant, its equipment and the 200 acres of land. Digital said that it would continue operating the factory until it was sold, and that it wanted whoever bought the business to continue as a Digital supplier. The Westfield factory employs 445 people. There was no immediate indication what would happen to them.

title: Federal Signal reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Campus Journal; Georgetown Is Basking In Clinton's New Glow
description: The trees are bare, the weather wintry, but Georgetown University is experiencing an early spring because of President Clinton, class of 1968.

title: AT LUNCH WITH: Nigel Hamilton; A Target for the Longbows of Camelot
description: THE lunchtime crowd at the "21" Club was typical: mostly male, soberly suited, well padded for the most part and, given the prices, certainly well heeled.

title: Consumer Confidence Shows Slight Decline
description: Consumer confidence slipped a bit this month, after rising in December, the Conference Board said yesterday.

title: Strawberry Swings a Bat For First Time in 5 Months
description: DARRYL STRAWBERRY , returning from back surgery, swung a bat for the first time since September and said he felt fine.

title: Asking 'What Can I Do?' And Giving to Neediest
description: New Yorkers sometimes feel that to survive in their city, they must steel themselves to the poverty that spills onto the sidewalks. Perhaps they force themselves to tune out pleas for spare change or to ignore a haggard woman sleeping in a box near their apartments. But every so often an experience may pierce that armor.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A2-8 U.N. CHIEF THREATENS ISRAEL

title: Confusion and Error Are Rife In Hospital Billing Practices
description: AFTER Frederick Ruof had hip replacement surgery last summer, he received a $27,000 bill that divided the total into broad categories like nursing, radiology and laboratory fees. But Mr. Ruof, who works in Baltimore, wanted to know exactly what his insurer was paying for and requested an itemized bill.

title: Witness in Assault Trial Says Acts Were Immoral
description: A defense witness, Paul Archer, finished testifying in the Glen Ridge sexual assault trial today by calling the sexual activities between his brother and three friends and their mildly retarded schoolmate immoral but not illegal.

title: Public Relations Merger Seems Near
description: Robinson, Lake, Lerer & Montgomery and the Sawyer/Miller Group, among the county's best-known public relations agencies, are close to an agreement to merge, industry executives said yesterday, confirming a report in The Washington Post.

Brinker, misstated the market value of his holdings in the company. They are worth approximately $56 million, or 4 percent of the company's total market value of $1.4 billion.
